review: I got a gift card for CPK, so I tried them out this week. I didn't know they had pasta, sandwiches and entrees, so that was a nice surprise.  I ordered a 5 cheese & fresh tomato pizza and the buffalo cauliflower appetizer. Man that cauliflower was spicy, but good! Pizza was fine.  Take out is easy to do- I called ahead and waited a few minutes.

What has happened to CPK? I ordered a Waldorf salad (half size) which was $13! Yikes! There was barely any lettuce in it at all and so many apples and grapes. So basically I ordered the worlds smallest fruit salad for $13. So I wondered what a full size salad cost = $16.29.  I'm pretty sure I will never return to a cpk again. There are so many other places to grab a pizza and salad for a decent price.  I wish I took a pic of that fruit salad - it was so depressing in its little to go container.

Placed a To Go order to be picked up and as I was driving up I get a call saying the item is seasonal and they no longer carry it. Do I want to cancel my order? I'm sitting in the parking lot... I walk in to talk to them and they offer the option to order something else and wait. That's it. I speak to the manager and explain I took the time to call, drive down and this is frustrating. Now I'm waiting. She agreed and said they would hurry AND WALKED AWAY while another person took my money. So here I sit. Waiting in a crowd of people for something I really didn't want that I'm paying for. I would NOT recommend this place. UPDATE:  Don't order the Cobb Salad!  The bacon was old and rubbery. There were 3 shavings of chicken bits. The rest was the REALLY BITTER white center portion of iceberg lettuce that you would not eat.  I am so disappointed that I followed through after being treated poorly, paid for a meal I didn't want and brought home a terrible "dinner" after a long day of work.

I Love CPK!! Any chance I'm near one, I crave their food! I just got done with a 7 mike hike with my family and dog so we went here after! They are dog friendly (on the patio) and the service is great. We had Michele today and she was the sweetest! She gave us great service and she loved our dog, so that was a plus too! The food here is amazing to say the least. Today I got tke cucumber Revitalizer beverage and it was SO GOOD and super refreshing! They are not complimentary refills though - FYI. I got 2 because they were so good. Their spicy cauliflower appetizer is what I crave the most! It's the perfect snack and absolutely delicious.

Its been years since I've last been to a CPK, yet alone this particular location. I was very surprised at how delicious their food was.  My wife and I enjoyed a small salad, the buffalo cauliflower and sausage pizza.  All were yummy and filling. It was great being able to come in, be seated and served in less than 30 minutes.   The place wasn't too busy and our server was also the bartender.  I was worried at first that my wife and I wouldn't get good service. I was wrong.  Amanda was excellent.  Topping off our drinks and clearing out plates, etc.  I'll be back again for sure.  Maybe during Sunday Funday to watch some football and throwback a few drinks.

This place isn't a regular in my rotation but it is pretty good nevertheless.  With CPK you kinda know what you're gonna get: an extensive menu littered with all kinds of glorious options to choose from in a very amiable atmosphere and chances are good that you'll probably have a great time.  On my last visit I had one of their supreme pizzas and it was solid. Not on of the best things I've ever had but I enjoyed every bite. Their sandwiches are surprisingly enjoyable and the service is always friendly. It's not always on my agenda to go here, but when I do I find myself satisfied. Good.

For the longest time this place wasn't on the food radar for me because of one bad experience with some flavorless pasta, BUT my boyfriend loves this place so we decided to give it another try and I loved it. Their pita bread is delicious and the pizza was great as well. They messed up my boyfriends order but they immediately made him a new pizza for free. Their customer service was fantastic, and I definitely look forward to coming back again!

This is one of my favorite pizza places of all time. You can't go wrong with anything here but def try adding an egg on your pizza as it really brings out the flavor. If you decide to get salad the bbq chicken salad is literally my favorite salad ever. Pro tip order the pita bread here it's only a dollar you get a bunch of it and it's as delicious as pizza. My last experience here they got my pizza order completely wrong and not only did they change they redo it they let me keep the original pizza for free. If you're looking for some great customer service I don't think you can go wrong with this place.
Great food and service. Sit at the bar and ask for Francisco - great service with a smile no matter how busy it is

I've been to the Carmel Mt. CPK many times and mostly it is a fine and delicious experience.  The servers are always friendly and aim to please.   I will continue to patronize this CPK - because there are times when I absolutely must have a particular menu item and because it's only 5 minutes from home. There are two issues that irk me, however. They have discontinued the Moroccan Salad and the Chinese Chicken Salad.  Why??!!!! And.  Their rewards program leaves much to be desired.  Not only does just ONE person receive rewards credit from a party of two or more at the table - somehow this seems odd and unfair - but twice to date the server has assured us that the check amount would be posted to the rewards account, but that was not the case.  Nothing was posted. CPK almost never has "specials" and discounts, and I was hoping that the rewards deal would give a bit of a break.  It seems that this is not necessarily the case.  They could do better!

I'd give it more stars but for a small reg mozzarella cheese pizza and a small Italian chopped salad it was almost $30! That's way too much sorry. The salad has a good dressing the only reason I ordered it lol. The pizza was good and thinly sliced-I'd go back but I'd bring a friend to split it since it was too pricey for one person for lunch.

We ordered food to go online, picked it up, came home and were very disappointed. The food was yummy, but there were a couple mishaps.  First, I don't think they pay attention to the "Special Requests" section when you order online. If you're not going to pay attention or acknowledge it, don't give us that option! We both requested additional items that were not honored.  Second, there was a GRAPE in my husband's Cesar dressing for his salad. That is not okay. Food preparation training needs to be addressed with whoever prepares the food there. It makes me wonder what else they do behind closed doors. CPK used to be my favorite place to eat, but I'm finding myself disliking it the more I eat it. Sadly, I would not recommend it to anyone.

A local mainstay, this place is so awesome as the menu is extensive and delicious . If your on a diet there many options and if your not then go for the goodness. We had the mushroom, pepperoni and sausage thin crust. Pizza was perfection, wood fired bliss. The dual soup was tremendous with tortilla and potato split in a single bowl. Great job team !

For some reason this was a bad lunch choice all around.  The parking lot was being re-paved surrounding this restaurant.  I ended up having to park across a very busy street and walk to the restaurant.  There was a large lunch crowd and we had to wait fifteen minutes to be seated.  We were told this up front and we were ok with the wait since our car was so far away.  We were finally seated at a nice booth and had our drinks served promptly.  We started with an appetizer, the white corn guacamole and chips for $5.  When it arrived my lunch companion and I were both hugely disappointed as it was a one cup serving of some cubed avocado, but it mostly consisted of corn and beans.  There was so much filler and barely any guacamole that we really felt ripped off.  Also there was a handful of chips, I think this could have been a much bigger serving.  We then split the Thai Chicken pizza, which was not as tasty as I imagined it would be.  There wasn't much chicken on there and we were both still hungry and so we rolled the dice to see if the dessert would bring some happiness to our lunch.  We ordered the Salted Carmel Pudding since most of the other desserts charged extra for the ice cream that was pictured in the desserts and when you added up the price we didn't think ordering them made much sense.  When our salted carmel pudding arrived with two spoons we laughed because the glass dish you could see there was about an inch of pudding in the glass and the rest was filled with whipped cream.  After dessert my friend and I decided that we would never come back to California Pizza Kitchen again.

PSA: the carne asada pizza is back!!  Got the oven roasted turkey sandwich and the turkey was a little dry, but the honey dijon sauce was tasty.  The lettuce on my Caesar salad was old and drenched in dressing so it was meh.  Conclusion: stick with getting pizza!

Sitting at the bar , wasting time to meet parents ... Spicy buffalo cauliflower is always the go to... Kendall was a super server handling the walk up bar guests. Surprisingly friendly , courteous , helpful- meaning beyond my expectations! Good for her . Solana Beach is my regular location but over here for the parents , glad I came in.

Thank you, Kendall for the excellent service today. I was a little thrown off when I walked in. We weren't immediately greeted and had to wait for someone to seat us but my restaurant experience turned around when Kendall seated us. I explained how CPK had the asparagus spinach spaghettini and had taken it off the menu. If it wasn't for my friend, I wouldn't have come in. Kendall said that they were able to make my favorite dish. She was so pleasant and understanding. She was the perfect server and moving forward, I would come to this CPK even if they couldn't make this dish. All because of Kendall. What an asset to CPK. Thank you, Kendall!!!!!

Wow, how does this place stay in business? I'm going to assume it is 100% by having the word "California" in the title giving that old hometown pride feeling of nostalgia or some crap. Stopped by today with Wee One and my brother and sister-in-law visiting from out of state. We decided to come here because "It has California in the name, it has to be the legit California experience".   We started with the "small plate" fried Mac and cheese and they aren't kidding about the small. It is literally four balls, about half the size of a golf ball for $5. I wouldn't pay $1.25 each for an actual golfball, let alone something half the size of a golf ball that is just going to only stay with me for the next day, tops. So I ordered the $14 Thai chicken pizza, Brother had the $14 barbecue chicken sandwich, Sis-in-law had the $14 classic crispy chicken sandwich, Wee One had the $5.50 kids Hawaiian Pizza, and I grabbed a $14 cheese and tomato pizza home for Hubs. The Thai chicken pizza had very little peanut sauce so it was very dry, had even less chicken, and had a mountain of carrots, bean sprouts and scallions. I like vegetable as much as the next person (and probably more) but when it is 90% of the pizza, it is a bit ridiculous. And it is definitely something you can eat on your own. The BBQ chicken sandwich did not taste like Bbq at all. It was mushy chicken and even mushier fried onions. Both sandwiches decided to have the farmers market soup as a side and it was awful. The flavor was very similar to the spicy chowder type soups they sell in cans at the supermarket. It had chunks of raw veggies (they claimed to be roasted, but I am not buying that...) and a "drizzle" of olive oil on top that would probably be more adequately described as an "oil spill/ecological disaster" of olive oil on top. Seriously, we thought BP had been through the kitchens (Too soon?). The crispy chicken had a tiny piece of chicken in a huge square roll (because they think chicken is square?) so only the middle had chicken in it. Most of the sanwiches was just dry bread with lettuce and a ton of mayo oozing everywhere (See picture). Wee One's kid-sized pizza was the most appropriately priced but clearly the people who designed the kids menu items have no idea what ACTUALLY children are like. The ham was thinly sliced, but it was in huge pieces so W.O. kept choking on it. I had the take all the pieces off, tear them into edible non-choky chunks and then put them back on. The pineapple was also super huge chunks that had to be torn into smaller pieces for kid-sized mouths. The pineapple had a lot of the outer bits still on it like when you don't cut enough of the rind off, which is a bit irritating in a pizza. W.O. also asked for a refill on his chocolate milk and had to keep waiting and waiting. Not sure why it took 5 minutes to get a refill on chocolate milk when our server came up twice to say "the chocolate milk will be right up". The take home pizza was fine with the proportions and flavors, but still really expensive for a dinner plate-sized pizza. All together, including tip, this meal came to $80!!! Overall, I think California should petition to have the name changed so this restaurant doesn't sully California's name. I will never be returning to this place when the pizza at Little Caesars tasted similar to this "gourmet" crap and was twice the size for a third of the price. And doesn't choke toddlers.

I have no complaints about the food or service.  They only problem I have is that this location is very run down and extremely dirty.  The tables have grime built up so thick you can scrape it off with a knife. See the attached photos.  Absolutely disgusting.  If you look up, the air duct vents are caked with dust.  This location needs a remodel.

I was looking for a job this last Saturday and I called to see if they were hiring and they said yes we are looking for a dishwasher and we are excepting applications on Tuesday between 2p. and 4p. When I got there around 3p. the hiring manager CHRISTIAN saw me and all of a sudden they were not in need of a dishwasher anymore. I had my food handlers certificate  and my non slip shoes on hand with 4 years of experience... He shot me down with no hand shake, just walked away so i left. Not even 3 minutes I went back in to retrieve my  application. Yep you know it! It was in the trash can. I walked out the door with my head up but I knew I had the wrong paint job... Don't get me wrong the food is delicious I mean A++  but for now I won't be going to the Carmel Mountain CPK until the management sees through fair eyes...

I think the three stars say it all, the food is good, but nothing that makes you cry tears of joy. I've never liked the pizza here (yes, I said it!) so I decided to try the jambalaya fettuccine. Some of the noodles were a bit al dente for my taste, but the biggest issue was that the noodles weren't cooked evenly. Some were undercooked, some weren't. It was sort of an emotional roller coaster for my mouth because I never knew what I was going to get. The pasta wasn't quite as seasoned as I hoped, but the saving grace was the chorizo. Granted, I've never encountered under seasoned chorizo ANYwhere, but it was the shining star of the dish. Would I come here again? Sure, I guess. The location is convenient, and my friends/family seem to like it more than I do. But I certainly wouldn't go out of my way.

As a first time customer this place was pretty good.  People here are friendly and very welcoming.  Our server Marija was very nice and very on top of things.    Shes a top performer!!  The reason I didn't give it five stars was because our food took long to come out.  Other than that this place did meet your standards.

Father's Day. I can agree service but there was hardly anyone here when we arrived. Placed us in a tiny booth for 4 even though we are a party of 5.  Food came out pretty fast but it took more than 10 month get a cup of water.  Wife loves the salad so we come iften but I am not a fan.

The customer service in this place has become horrible we have to get up to get our own salt we have to ask for our own bread we have to call the waitress several times and then we had a waitress that just threw our straws at us...the place is going down hill fast...

I always enjoy CPK, I'm not a chain restaurant goer but I'm okay with them for lunch and CPK is always a good go to spot.  I always get the Thai crunch salad and went for something different today. I tried the roasted veggie salad and it was very delicious.  The veggies were nicely grilled, I love hot veggies on a salad.  I had 2 different types on dressings on the side and the half is a really good sized portion.  My coworker with me enjoyed her BBQ chicken pizza. Daniel was our server and he was great, he could see we were on a quick lunch break and got us in and out.  Very friendly and overall a great server! I do feel CPK is a little expensive, I know they raised their prices a few years ago and $16 for a salad and a diet coke is a little more than what I wanna pay at lunchtime but it's good. My only negative, I asked for a diet coke and received a diet Pepsi, I'm not a fan of diet Pepsi and wish restaurants would tell you it's Pepsi when you order.  This is not anything against our server or CPK, it's just the norm in restaurants, us diet coke addicts are very picky :) I of course will definitely be back for more great food!

Slow service and the female receptionist was rude and condescending. Hope she gets fired. We asked a simple question if we get a drink with a to go kids meal and she rolled her eyes and scoffed. I didn't get her name, but she worked Wednesday at 6. Terrible don't come.

I love CPK, hands down my favorite place to get pizza!  Make sure to ask for their complimentary bread! Complimentary Bread - Served warm & with olive oil. White Pizza = No sauce.  Mozzarella, ricotta, Parmesan, Pecorino Romano, spinach, & garlic.  Seriously, so flavorful! Pear & Gorgonzola = Pears, Caramelized onions, hazelnuts, topped with a salad with Gorgonzola ranch.  Perfect mix of flavors!  I like to get the salad on the side for an extra meal.  Cedar Plank Salmon = Served with white corn & spinach, topped with feta.  The salmon is good but a little bland & dry. For the pizza, you can get Original or Thin Crust.  If you cannot choose between pizzas, like I cannot, you can get 2 of your favorites as 1 pizza for extra $.

Normally a review would be about the food but we didn't even get that far. We walked in and after a couple minutes, my husband and I were seated at a booth and looked over the menu. It was not too busy inside. Ten minutes passed and no waiter came by. Not even a "We'll be with you in a minute". My husband saw another couple who had come in several minutes after us get attended to. So, we walked out hungry and took our business elsewhere. Horrible service.

Thank you CPK for offering Silayan Filipina a fundraiser!  Print and present Sat/Sun Oct 18-19, 2014 at select So. Cal CPKs.  My hubby and I absolutely enjoyed sharing  *the Sausage & Fennel Flatbread (crispy crust, gooey cheese, and mild-spicy peppers) *the Roasted Peach Salad with bacon - refreshing and with lots of satisfying crunch and crumbles of blue cheese * the Chicken Piccata pasta was also a hit:  the right balance of capers and lemon, and 3 chicken breasts - plenty to share, and the angel hair pasta was cooked to al dente perfection.   We were too stuffed for our usual dessert: the Key Lime pie, but since we had savored the very tasty Mojito/Agave drink, we left quite happy.  Chris took great care of us at this early dinner meal service.  (some of the previous experiences have been hit or miss) and happily I can say that today was a return to excellent standards!
Pizza is amazing and the Kung pao pasta with the shrimp is really good. Always enjoy watching the cooks cook in the open kitchen area (keeps the kids entertained during the meal). Decent service.

We both enjoyed our pasta, the bread is much better than the plain white slices they used to have and the butter cake was to die for! Good to celebrate valentine's day a couple days off on a weeknight!

I never thought i would like this place but my family and i decided to give it a try. And boy are we glad we did. The margaritas are amazing. Food is great. And Adel is the best server ever. He was so nice and friendly. Was kind enough to go over the menu with us and we never felt rushed. We will def be back and asking to sit in Adel's section again!

Came for lunch around 2:30 on Saturday. There were only about 8 tables with diners. We were greeted and our drink orders taken very quickly, and then our food order (Kung Pao spaghetti w shrimp and the asparagus-spinach linguine) was taken right away. Then we waited....Sarah, our server, refilled our tea after a few minutes, and then disappeared. After about 30 minutes, we flagged down the manager and asked where our food was; he apologized and said there was a problem with their ticket printer and ours got lost. He said they were making our order and it would be out in a couple minutes. My husband said not to rush it, just make it right. No problem! The shrimp on my dish was not cooked completely, so they had to remake my meal...the manager apologized and said he would comp our meal and offered a free dessert. Nice, but by this point it had been an hour, and we were just done. Oh and Sarah? She finally stopped back by on our way out....and she never even acknowledged that she had lost our order and then ignored us, let alone apologize for it. Wow.

This location is big, but stays busy for lunch and dinner.  Service is attentive and I've had a couple servers  that went above and beyond to offer suggestions and modifications to make my meal amazing. I really enjoy the asparagus and spinach spaghettini. I would have never ordered that, but it was suggested (with extra checca) and now I get it all the time. Pizzas are great, my favorite is still the Thai chicken. Baja spring rolls are delight as well. Salads are tasty and plentiful.

Every time I visit CPK I order the Moroccan chicken salad. Went there at 3 pm March 27 2017 and ordered the usual. This time it was good but not great- very little chicken.  The service was pretty slow but probably at minimum staff at that time of day.
The staff at the center bar outside of the restaurant at North County Fair Mall are awesome and remember us when we come in;).  Good food too;)

I was in a hurry so I walked up to the counter to order a pizza to go. It looked really elegant inside. I wish I could of stayed. Oh well, I definitely will next time. I ordered a Thai Chicken Pizza. I was very hungry and concerned that the pizza looked too small. I only had to wait about 10 minutes and it was fresh and hot. It smelled so good I couldn't wait to get home, so I ate half of it in the car. And the other half at home. It was the perfect size, I was full after I finished eating. The Thai Chicken Pizza was amazing! The peanut sauce with the little slivers of peanuts was so tasty. The crust edges were slightly crispy and perfect. The Chicken was cooked just right too. I also loved the sprouts on top. Just a perfect fusion of flavors. I can't wait to go back and sit at a table and enjoy the ambience and try another one of their wonderful pizzas.

Even though I didn't order any food on this fine Monday evening, my experience at CPK tonight was still for the ages. All the credit has to go to the gracious and lovely hostess, anneJ. Her presence truly had an impact on my night. Don't even get me started on her sense of fashion and the lovely flowers on her name tag! It would be a shame for any establishment to lose her, and in fact I believe she might even be deserving of a promotion or raise!! All the best for the staff of CPK, especially my sweetheart anneJ. Thank you for such wonderful customer service!!! With gratitude, Brandon and Amelia

Came here for Father's Day lunch and to escape the heat. The food is consistently pretty good. Our pizza was disappointingly cold but other than that was good. Our drinks took forever both rounds took way too long. The service was good considering and always a nice family atmosphere.

Food was excellent!! My sister and I had gone there after a long day of working. Customer service was great and the hostess that sat us was beyond gorgeous! Lol no clue what her name was but she was a pretty blonde, if you see this message me lol

Went here to celebrate a birthday.  Our server was awesome. He recommended the roasted garlic chicken, and it was delicious!  The service was good, the food was served promptly. My experience was great.  I highly recommend California Kitchen in Mt. Carmel.

Visiting here on a Friday night with my sweetheart.  We are so glad she made the reservation because the line is going out the door! It's busy here but the setting is really nice. Our pizza had gotten cold by the time we got it, but the pasta was nice and hot. Everything tasted really good,  my favorite were the mac n cheese crisps. Our chicken tequila pasta tasted very good as well! All in all it was a good experience.  I was about to give 4 stars due to the noise factor and the time it took to get the food, but our server was really kind and they waived the charge for the appetizer so I am going to stick with 5 stars.

Decided to take my son to CPK to celebrate his birthday because it's one of his favorites.  When we arrived I mentioned to the hostess that it was my sons birthday and she said she would let our server know.  After being seated at 8:15 we waited for 15 minutes with no one coming over to mention they were busy so I asked a passing busser to get the manager.  After about 5 minutes the manager shows up with a spinach dip and tells us that our waiter forgot about us?  Then the waitress shows up and takes our drink and dinner order.  Yay things are happening!  It takes 5 minutes for the drinks to show up and the another 20 for the food.  My son asked for a side of ranch before the server left and 10 minutes later he got up and asked one of the kitchen staff for a side of ranch.  The appetizers showed up at the same time as the dinner which is always great.  After dinner we boxed our leftovers and paid our bill.  When we left my son asked why the people at the restaurant didn't celebrate his birthday?  I didn't have an answer for him.
This place is jam packed right now and they still seated us promptly and quickly delivered hot and delicious food with a smile.

Great atmosphere but sometimes the service can be a little slow. I come with my family about once a month and we are never disappointed. I always go for the BBQ Chicken pizza because it always hits the spot!

I'm visiting and man this is one of the best pizzas I've had in a while and the customer service was great! Our server Gabe was phenomenal and very informative and quick about filling our drinks and bringing our food out in a proper manor!! Thank you guys for the amazing hospitality.

It has been a long time since I have been to a CPK. I recently moved and now there is one very close to me. I ordered the halibut, it was not great but good. Perhaps this was my fault because I ordered fish at a pizza joint. I did order a Thai pizza to go for the roommate but had a slice now that is an amazing pizza.. I sat at the bar and had great service. I have always loved their pizza and salad so I think I will stick to that.
Slow service sometimes, but the food is good. I love their salads and they are always fresh.  Pizza variety is fantastic.

Food was good, but the restaurant was filthy. Dusty wood, had to move tables because the first one they sat us in was sticky. Then at the new table they had to replace the appetizer plates because they were dirty.

Kyle is awesome! We have a big group of 16 people, multiple checks, people arriving at different times and were on a time crunch to get to the next destination.  Kyle handled it like a superstar! Great attitude! Never flustered or bothered. He remembered who ordered what, extra waters, lemons, coffee, napkins...etc etc.  I'm on Yelp just to appreciate Kyle!!!
We had a birthday dinner for my sister and had 13 people there    Our server was Cierra  She was awesome  She handled our party of 13 like it was nothing  She was great

We went to dinner around 6. We had about a 8-10 minute wait before we sat 3 of us. The atmosphere seemed busy. It was loud from other people dining. I couldn't remember if the TV or if music was playing in the background. They have outdoor seating but no one was out there. Our server got to us within 2-3 minutes of being sat.  We orders the white pizza, small mac n cheese bites and small salad (forgot exactly what it was called). The food came out in about 15 minutes. The pizza tasted excellent. Great option since we couldn't eat any meat. The mac n cheese wasn't that great, it was deep fried and a little grease. The service was ok. Our server never refilled our drinks. I guess it was just cuz it was busy, but other than that it was good service.  Parking was easy. Found a spot right away.  I would come back to try different types of pizza

The restaurant business is a tough business. There are so many elements that are out of the restaurant managers hands. Tonight, we experienced one of those "tough" elements. Earlier in the week, I made a reservation for 12 for 6pm. When we arrived at 6pm we were told we were just waiting for some patrons that had already paid to leave. 6:10....6:15....6:35...FINALLY, we were seated not at the table we were waiting for but another one in the rear corner.  It's a "tough" business because you can't simply ask guests to leave their table because another party is waiting. What made it difficult for me was the fact that we made reservations for 6pm, we had someone that needed to leave at 7 and most importantly it was a birthday celebration. I could sense that the manager tonight wanted to make things right and was apologetic for the situation. Shortly after we sat, we've received multiple appetizers for the entire table in inconvenience for our wait. I really appreciated the gesture and hope that anyone who reads this, will treat all people with kindness and patience.  Overall, we had a great birthday celebration, everyone loved their food, and the manager and our server were truly exceptionally! Thank you to the manager and waiter. I wish I caught their names!  Thank you to the manager and our server at the CPK in Carmel Mountain!

The portions at this place have definitely shrunk - or whoever made our food the other night was being skimpy.  I've been here many times and ordered the same things from a small subset of my favorites, and noticed a change the last time I went! I always order the thai crunch salad, and BBQ chicken pizza - I think some of the best things on the menu.  Ever since I discovered the thai crunch salad I've ordered it every time I've been here.  It has edamame, peanuts, and crispy noodles in it.  Definitely a family favorite. Only had dessert once here, but it was amazing!  A really buttery pound cake with some very thick, decadent vanilla ice cream on top.  The cake was warm and the ice cream melted over the top - like heaven!  Enough to share with a few people (especially since the amount of butter in it is more than enough for a few people). Another nice thing about CPK is how empty it can be!  This could be a bad sign - but it was perfect the last time because we had tried 2 other restaurants before arriving at CPK and could get seated quickly. The food here is good - but definitely think portions and quality have changed a little over time.

Don't bother!!!! Brooke gets easily annoyed by children and can't help but roll her eyes at me and my daughter because we didn't particularly care for our entree.  I will never sit down in Brooke's station or with her employment ever again.

Just came in tonight for togo order get home and see my pesto chicken pasta had a whole 3 tiny pieces of chicken. And there was nothing creamy or pesto aboit this it tasted like just olive oil noodles so disappointed 15 for that was horrible. And all the rest of the food we ordered was cold so unhappy specially for the price

The food-great The service- great The cost- eh The time to get the food- over 30 minutes The BBQ Chicken Pizza was amazing. Loved it! I tried it with thin crust and it was definitely a good choice.  It took a long time to get our food, usually I would have been kind of upset because I was really hungry, but our waitress, Amanda, was great! Instead of just ignoring our table until the food came out, she notified us that the kitchen was backed up and brought us more bread and was attentive on the drinks.  Despite the lag on receiving the food, it tasted awesome and the service was great!

I didn't get the managers name but he did a great job last night when we ate there. The order was late and my pizza was damaged sort of in the oven.  they still brought it out so I wouldn't starve; even with the "damage to it was delicious!  The manager didn't even hesitate, he gave us another pizza to make up for the damaged one. I really want to complement them for doing that and not making me wait forever for another pizza!excellent service and excellent food.

WOW!!! A terrible experience with an inept waitress (started out good, but deteriorated quickly) and mediocre food for $39.  A Thai chicken salad with 3, maybe 4 slivers of chicken after searching the plate and we were given a half-order when we ordered the full-order. Stingy like another review mentioned.  No waitress around to even refill the iced-tea. A busboy got that job after he noticed an empty glass on the table. Doubt that we'll even be returning to this CPK again. Even the CPK manager on duty could care less about customers, and supported the new, inept wait staff. No meaningful follow-up.
Great food and great service!  The hubs and I got a soup and shared a pizza.  It is a nice atmosphere.   The kids meals are good too!!

Friendliest servers, reasonable prices, and ammmaaazzing menu with lots of vegetarian options that I love.  I recommend the tortilla chips with white corn guacamole, spicy buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese, and the pesto cream penne.  They also have an awesome kids menu, their kids sundaes are only $.99!!!

The best 3 things on the menu have to be the Thai Chicken Pizza and the Chicken Piccata! Absolutely superb.  End your meal with the Chocolate Soufflé dessert for an even better time.  NANDO IS THE BEST SERVER! He was so sweet & constantly checked on my boyfriend & I. Absolutely the best service I've received here to date. Love CPK!
This bums me out. I love CPK. But the last 4 times I've come here the service has been horrible. Worse than horrible. It's not even worth the yummy food. I'm super disappointed.

Review is a week late, but that's okay. Me and three others decided to stop by this location while on our way to a show at Qualcomm. We got in around 3pm, not too busy which is expected. We were greeted nicely by the host who sat us immediately. I can't remember our servers name now, but I think it was something like Tim or Tom. He kept up with our needs and always had a great attitude as well.   Started off the the Avocado Egg rolls which are very tasty  We ordered the Spicy Chipotle Pizza which is AMAZING. Lots of flavor and just enough spice to make it interesting. Thai Crunch Salad with Avocado, BBQ Pizza, and Caesar Salad. Omnomnom Even the General Manager, Jen, said hi. Very nice lady, and it was great seeing her out and about helping out the crew! You don't see that too often. Will stop by this location if we are in the area again!

CPK.  Location is really convenient for a good team lunch.  It was our Administrative Assistant's birthday and she decided to do something close and fast.  She made a reservation for noon and this place was about 3/4 full.  We sat, we ordered, and we ate all the while saying how helpful and wonderful our Admin is.  Everyone at the table got different items, bit two of us got an old off the menu item, the BLT pizza.  This is by far my favorite pizza here.  I of course asked for extra bacon for an EXTRA $2.  Worth the price cause it had a lot of bacon taste. The service is good.  Tim was attentive and made sure we had our fill of drinks.

I made reservations for a Friday night dinner with my husband and was glad I decided to do so because the place was packed and people were standing around outside waiting to be called.  Within 5 minutes we were seated in a booth and our server had brought out menus.  We ordered drinks and then a small plate and our main plates.  Drinks came out but our app never made it to our table.   Our server went in to check on it and brought it out, but it wasn't what we'd ordered!  We'd ordered the Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla but we got the Crispy Mac n Cheese instead.  Our server was apologetic and left the mac and cheese for us to munch on while we waited.  Our quesadilla came out a few minutes later.  Quality wise, both the mac and cheese and the chicken quesadilla were delicious. Our Mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza wasn't hot when it hit the table, but was still yummy.  The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine was so tasty, with a slight tangy flavor. Things happen in food service, it appeared like there was something going on in the kitchen and there was a delay/mix-up with the food but our server did all the right things.  She checked on us and went to check on the food and at the end, she had her manager comp both of the small plates for the confusion.  Food was great, service good.  I would return.
Not a big fan of CPK, although I do like the Sicilian Pizza. Non-Pizza menu items never fail to underwhelm. Most recent visit marred by extremely dirty table/seats and unclean silverware.

I just want to say this place is awesome!   I love their food , but the main reason I think it's awesome is because sometimes you may have to wait a little longer because there food is so good I was helped by a manager named Katie.   So although I was upset she assured me that my food would be out and made sure I received awesome customer service!   Thank you Katie for keeping customer service alive!  :)

Came here with my family and the first impression was very negative as we walked through the door the two  of the host  Marissa & Jenna just stared us down and  were just talking and didnt even greet us. Host are suppose to be the first impression for there guest and customers and they sure disappointed us and didnt make us feel welcome... A couple minutes later a family behind us experienced the same thing with the host and was very angry. However, they were waiting 10 minutes also they didnt feel welcomed as well. They spoke to a manager about the issue they had. After the manager spoke to one of the host out side the host started talking to other associates about the issue. Don't think we will be coming to this location if they keep this going which is very unfortunate...

Stopped in with my spouse around 4:00pm on 8/19 to have a light dinner before our movie at 5:00pm. We were totally ignored when we walked in and waited to be seated, I finally had to call out to the chef's to ask what was the deal. It looks like the Head Chef took matters into his own hands and seated us where we were ignored again by the waiters who appeared to be engaged with themselves and not the customers wanting to order. We walked out...it will be a long time before I take my restaurant business back to that location. Very disappointed...we had not experienced that level of poor service in a long time.

We arrived at 9:58pm and the hostess, who turned out to be the manager said, "sorry, but we closed at 10."  We told her it wasn't 10 yet, and she showed us her watch which showed 10.  I told her to look at her cash register, which showed 9:59.  She then said, "oh, well let me seat you." So we sat down and started looking at the menu.  About five minutes later a waitress came by and said, "sorry folks, but the kitchen is closed." We proceeded to argue with her about when their closing time is, and what time we arrived.  She said she couldn't do anything about it.  I asked to speak to the manager -- she said the manager seated us. She said it didn't matter, as the kitchen was closed. By this time I realized if we pushed it they would have to feed us, but I didn't wanted ticked off cooks making my food.  So we expressed our disappointment with their horrible customer service and left. I used to work in the restaurant industry so I understand the necessity for customer service.  They definitely lack it. Also, who is running the place anyway, the cooks or the manager? What a joke!! We won't come back!

I love that this restaurant is so close to us. It's one of my favorites. I don't really order pasta anywhere else except here and I really crave it sometimes. My favorites from here are all the pastas, the Thai Crunch salad, and the spinach artichoke dip! This place is perfect for date night or for takeout. Love the curb side pick up cause sometimes after a long day of work i'm just too tired and too lazy to get in and out the car. Literally everything here is superb! I'm starting to think they have a magic ingredient they put on everything that makes them all amazing.

Our first time in around early dinner time 4:00 pm. Our waitress was the best I've probably ever had. She was very kind and caring her name is Amber. We loved the appetizers avocado egg rolls, and spinach dip. The bbq chicken pizza was okay. Could have used more sauce. Overall we had a great experience.

Placed a phone order and dropped in to pickup before heading to my hotel. The lady on the phone was so nice and the lady at the phone order pickup area was as well (might have been the same one, not sure). My salad was ready but waited a few minutes for fresh warm bread. The Cobb salad is just amazing here, especially with the optional beets, yum!

Oh how CPK has changed. We ordered Thai pizza, Chinese Chix salad and cheese pizza. The salad was doused in dressing and a far cry from the days when there were fresh cashews and oranges in it. The Thai pizza had a long stringy piece of green onion on it and no chicken. Vegetables barely julienned, including g bitter bean sprouts, were dumped on top. Caitlyn our waitress stopped by and chirp like asked, "How's everything tasting?" Don't ask if you don't want to know, Caitlyn. I told her I didn't like the salad at all and showed her the green onion with a laugh. "That's how it's supposed to be," she responded snotty. Ah Caitlyn. That's how to lose a tip. The manager came by and apologized, my husband scraped most of the topping off in his napkin because he was so hungry and just ate the dough. Ugh.

We like CPK's food (at least most of the adult food) but dislike the service. This location is no different. Service sucked and we were also not impressed with the food this time. Now that my baby is eating restaurant food we started ordering kid meals when we go out. We went there on a Sunday little past the regular lunch hour (maybe around 1:45pm). First the service: We were seated by the hostess and sat there for maybe like 10+ minutes before I asked some random server/supervisor that we want to order some food (my daughter was hungry). He asked if anyone showed up to greet and take our order, I said no they did not. That guy talked to a couple of ladies at the billing desk a table away from mine, one of those ladies was our server. Our server was neither smiling nor welcoming (not sure if it was because we asked for someone to take our order instead of waiting indefinitely). She seemed overworked (which is usually the trend we noticed at CPK) and too busy to greet and make proper eye contact. I ordered kids Mac&Cheese, water and the usual bread they serve. I requested the kids meal be brought out ASAP. I said I'll order the entree's when she brings the M&C out. We got water immediately and bread in a short while but it was a while before the M&C was out. Now the food: Turns out Mac & Cheese (on the kids menu) sucks at CPK!! It was not the traditional or classic Macaroni, they made it with the fusilli (thick curly pasta). Pasta was half cooked and absolutely dry with no visible cream or cheese. This is what you serve for kids? We tried to feed that dry half cooked pasta to my daughter but she did not like it.  After a little while we could get hold of our server and I asked for extra cheese and cream to be brought out, which took a while again to come out. My Pizza, Wife's salad and soup came out fine and were good (they usually are) including the substitutes we requested. Thanks for that I guess?

Gave 2 stars earlier, it's now back to 5 stars. My daughter eats the grilled chicken and broccolini. It's probably the best kids entree in any restaurant in our area that is healthy (not a hot dog, deep fried food...). We only came back here because we had a gift card to spend.  The staff no longer seems short handed.
Amazing place to eat. Veggie and 4 cheese pizza, and butter cake with ice cream. Yum!!!

I've been going to CPK on and off in different states for several years.  Tonight against my better judgment the five of us went for dinner the food was decent but it took 45 minutes for our dinner to come.  Did I say 45 minutes for dinner to come and they came by and offered us desserts due to the inconvenience. I will never go back to the CPK in Carmel Mountain they obviously don't know what the heck they're doing for to take almost an hour to get a general order.   Fire the general managerbecause here she is running a terrible restaurant

Pizza was amazing... as always!... great location and Francisco was amazing! Give the man a raise! For a chain this is the best in Southern California. Definitely returning!  P.s. Shout out to the cooks the Sicilian pizza and the artichoke dip are mouth watering.

First time here and waited for an hour for our lunch. Manager came to apologize for the long wait cuz somebody took our orders to the wrong table so in order to make up for the inconvenience, the manager took out the whole bill for free!!! Speaking of good service here! Thank you California Pizza Kitchen & Jaime, the manager!  By the way, food was great too! Will surely come back!

The food is awesome and the service is usually pretty good. When I get the spicy chicken pizza it is awesome when I dine in. When I order for a pickup they do not give you as many toppings and it's disappointing

I've always had excellent customer service ordering here. I had exceptional customer service today for a togo order. Not sure of the name of the person that took care of my order because it only says ETTOGO on the receipt.  The food has always been cooked perfectly- even when I request changes/additions like "Add tomatoes," "Add extra sauce," "Side of lemon please." My boyfriend and I get take out quite often and it always seems to receive less care as opposed to us dining in. I've never had a problem with this CPK. Even if I make a Togo order, the staff upfront are ALWAYS polite and professional- often opening the door when I walk in. You can't find many places like that. I am very satisfied with the customer service, food quality and care. :D

Went here with another couple for dinner. When we arrived for our reservation, walk ins were told the wait was about an hour and 15. Luckily, I decided to make a reservation about an hour and some beforehand so our wait was 20 minutes.  The service was friendly and somewhat efficient. Understandably, it was busy so it took a while for our food to come out, but not bad. Food quality, nothing special but good.  Price wise, it's definitely $$. My friends and I (4 total of us) ordered 1 appetizer, 3 pizzas and a pasta dish and it came out to a little more than $80.
What a disappointment. Went last night after the movies. Poor service. Pizza undercooked. I would not go back!

The food is good, but this place needs some serious improvement to management. Appears to be zero oversight from a customer's viewpoint. Bartender was very friendly, but completely overwhelmed, while other employees stood around chatting. Food came out with entrees before appetizers, waited even longer for a little bit of bread, which came out last. Nice server, good food, bad management. Will not go back to this location, far to much disorganization & lack of awareness by management. Get it together CA Pizza Kitchen
Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza is very good with ranch. Farmers market soup is an excellent option to start with.

I am a frequent guest of CPK -- this time was really great!  The service was SPOT ON!  We were in a bit of a hurry to get to an event and they came through!  Awesome location - they are on top of it here!

Fantastic service!!! Jesse was our servers name and he was incredible!!!! Very polite and personable!!!! This location has never failed me!!!! My husband and I love coming here for date lunches because of how great the service is!!!!

The BBQ chicken pizza is great. The sit in service is good. The takeout service is TERRIBLE! I called as I left home so it'd be ready when I get there, but I sat on the phone for over a half-hour with no answer. So when I got there I walked inside and the guy manning the takeout was talking to a customer about cars for a long time. Take my order, please!

Super pleased that they have a Lite menu. I had the Grilled Chicken Chimichurri - a spicy sauce made with parsley, garlic, chili flakes or jalapeño and vinegar to name a few things. So so flavorful! And it came with a heap of fresh roasted veggies. The dish would've been perfect if the chicken wasn't dry. CPK - please fix that! I'd then feel a little better about paying $16. I love the Waldorf salad, too! The large is large enough for 3 girls to share as a side to a main meal.

Food very reliably good here, workers overworked...whoever is current management needs to consider hiring back to fill staff. This restaurant is not slow by any standards. Average wait time now way up, waiting area standing room only, bartender down to one person now! That's a lose-lose scenario. They'd make a lot more and keep customers by getting your second bartender back to keep things moving.
This is my family's favorite CPK location. We eat here every 2 weeks. Service and staff are always great!
Warm and friendly staff(Donna) and quick to take our orders and helpful to explain the menu to suit our choices. Tasty quality food. Good wifi and music too!
Food good a bit pricey for the quality and quantity.  Worst part of visit was hearing a manager yell and belittle an employee.  Not cool.  Not cool at all.  (Think manager name was Rob or Robert).

CPK! Love, love, love many things about this place. If you love cobb salad, this is the best it's gonna get.  Take the beets on, they're good for you. Another salad winner is the roasted veggie. Add on the salmon or chicken and eat this up. My son loves the thin crusted sicilian. What can I say? He's a meat eater. The pasta is not too shabby either.  Tequila fettuccine or pesto cream penne with sun-dried tomatoes keeps me coming back for more...yum yum yum! The butter cake is divine and should be shared with a loved one!  The salted caramel is tasty too, you're gonna want to steal one or two spoonfuls of this heaven. Here's a few tips to enjoy your experience. 1) Eat off hours.  Yeah it gets packed at dinner, so if you need your CPK fix eat an early dinner at 4. 2) If you have a small party of 2 and it's packed, jump at the seats on the bar.  The service is faster and better! 3) It's CPK. The P stands for Pizza.  If you want Mexican carnitas or chile relleno, you should probably head over to a Mexican restaurant. If the customer is always right, then be the right customer! Aloha~T
Best server Sina. Made their boring place really cool and fun. Thank you for making our experience memorable.
I started going to this restaurant chain again lately. I like their pear Gorgonzola Pizza, perfect thin crust!  Fair service and the wait during lunch time is not bad.

Came here on Friday night. Food came very quickly. I want to gush about our server Amy. She was extremely attentive and kind, while a man who I assume was the manager or owner kept running around making sure everything was working smoothly and smiling at everyone. The food was amazing: I specifically recommend the spinach artichoke dip and the Moroccan chicken salad. Only issue was we called ahead but still had to wait about 20 min upon arrival.  Regardless, the food and service made up for that.

This is a review of their catering. I think "catering" is actually a fancy name for large order. I like that you can do everything online. That is life saving for me because I often do things last minute, I like looking things over before I put in an order, and I sorta hate talking on the phone. I have no idea when or why this became a part of who I am but nowadays I only talk to people who cannot text. Hate the phone otherwise. Anyway I put my order in early in the morning. I showed up to get my order and was told they were running late. Which is fine I guess but I was told in a way that made it seem like it could be 5 mins late or 30. Usually it would be no big deal, but when I am bringing food to a hungry account with a limited time to feed them and do my thang I get a little anxious.  In all they were about ten to 15 mins late no biggie. Still if you need an order on time then make sure you put it in for pick up early. I got a large pasta order. It leaked all over. Sorta lame because I took great care in delivering it. The food was good and I think you get about what you pay for. I like that they include two huge salads. The desert plate is just cookies and brownies. Nothing to get hyped over. My account enjoyed the food. They did not enjoy the mess it made. I would think twice before getting an order from here again.  Also I hate the $2 cans of soda. Last, when they helped me get the food to my car the service improved. I think maybe they were slammed. Still, order early!

By far the worst service I have ever experienced.  Called for curbside pick up. Took someone 10 minutes just to come out.  Had my name wrong, and they actually argued about it. Don't know how you get Yvette from Heather. He took the credit card and didn't come back for another 10 minutes (and why don't they just take payment over the phone at the time of order??). The lettuce wraps had no sauce with them, along with only 2 servings in the to go package when there is 5 pieces of bib lettuce. No sauce with the avocado egg rolls. No bread with the pasta for my kids. We have lived in Carmel mountain for 12 yrs. Haven't been to CPK in about 5 yrs, now I remember why. Food was just alright. Don't waste your money at this location.

What happened to good service? What happened to employees caring about good customer service? My family and I had dinner last night at CPK on Carmel Mountain Road. I got there around 6pm.  Asked for a table for 3.  A gentleman walked me all the way to the very end, to a table in the very far right corner where you are covered and its very private.  I asked to be moved to the main area and to be around people.  He took me over to a booth that was empty, but needed to be cleaned, as dirty dishes were still on the table. I sat down. Someone came over and took the dirty dishes away.   Our waiter came over and asked me for my drink order.  I asked him to please have someone wipe the table as it was used by someone before me and had dirty forks and dishes on it.  Here is the KICKER!!! He bend down and started looking at the table.  He was actually looking to see if the table was dirty!!! Really?  Anyhow, he came back with a towel.  Wiped it 1/2 way in the middle. Then comes the ordering part.  We ordered 1) one pea soup 2) one tortilla soup, one appetizer, a salad to split and one entree.  HERE IS HOW THIS WORKED: GOT THE APPETIZER.  NO ONE BOTHERED TO BRING US PLATES OR SILVERWARE.  WAITED FOR THAT. NEXT, 10 MINUTES LATER, CAME THE SALAD AND ENTREE.  NEVER GOT OUR SOUPS. Manager walked by and said, oh sorry, I will take that off your bill,  Waiter said, I forgot to ask you if you wanted your soup before or after the salad????? WOW??? REALLY??? SOUP AFTER SALAD??? So disappointing.  Will never go to CPK at this location again.

This place is always great.  Shane our server was extremely attentive to our table. Food was excellent as it usually is when we come here.  They have a good variety of food with great appetizers.  The restaurant is clean and has a fresh updated decor.   I always leave with a smile and a full stomach when I come here.

There was a 20 minute wait. Not too bad for a Friday. I had the pear and Carmelized onion pizza with spinach and kale and a Gorgonzola dressing. OOOOOH MYYYY  I had relationship with this thing. I closed my eyes and chewed and swear I heard taste bud angels sing. It was very large and quite good. The saltiness of the salad part offset the sweetness of the pear and onions. I have lunch tomorrow! Half that baby came home with me :-) told you we had a relationship.  Hubby had the Moroccan chicken salad: One of a kind, with roasted butternut squash, dates, avocado, toasted almonds, beets, chopped egg and cranberries. Tossed with housemade Champagne vinaigrette.  Every bite tasted different. What a combo. I gotta try that At home. Shared a red sangria. We gotta Make that at home too.    A bit spendy but we got FOUR MEALS. LOL dinner and lunch tomorrow :-) Nice waiter. Not intrusive. Personable. Checked back with us a little late after the food came but I was so busy getting to know that tasty disc in front of me I hardly noticed.... We gotta try dessert only here one night. I went into insulin shock hearing what they had!
Great food with fast and friendly service. Love the corn avocado chip dip stuff and can't go wronged that mushroom pizza and Caesar salad... Yum yum yum

Food was ok. Not that great. Service was 0. The waitress took our order and never came back to check on us. The manager dropped the food on the table. And at the end when I asked for the check she asked how was everything. Especially what pissed me off was she would go to all her other tables except mine. I said nothing to her but not coming back  :(

After a long day Valentine's Day we finally had a chance to relax and enjoy the evening.  "Sam" Samantha was our server.  She rocked.  Excellent customer service.  even when the incorrect pizza came out we were immediately reassured that the correct one was on its way.  They took responsibility for the mistake and made it right!!  This place is a well oiled machine and they are doing it right.  So super busy this night but it was amazing done right.  Love the food, price and service.  "cheers to a great staff"

THIS REVIEW IS FOR THIS VISIT ONLY!  Ordinarily, I don't have a problem with CPK.  I've found the food to be fresh and seasoned well.  This visit had nothing to do with food.  The Manager on Duty stopped at several of the tables, greeted the guests and asked about their dining experience.  I know he saw that we received and finished our food, but he never thought it necessary to visit mine.  Note to CPK - please treat all of your paying Customers the same....money is GREEN!  I would hate to think the snub had anything to do with ethnicity or race, but we were the only patrons at the time (that I noticed) who had a higher amount of melanin in our skin.

Such good service from Cameron and Josh tonight! My mom doesn't even use yelp but wanted me to leave a review. It was super busy tonight, but for good reason! I didn't even know CPK had a full bar, and it's actually kinda classy! Even with a half hour wait, it was still a nice environment to hang out and all the greeters were ultra hospitable. Josh made my mom and I two delicious adult drinks. I didn't even order anything specific so piña colada was a nice surprise! Big ol slice of pineapple, mmmm! Cameron was our waiter and he was so nice. Not too nice, either.. Like when it's kinda creepy lol.. But my mom was so impressed that he lowered himself down to our eye level to take orders. So much more personal. Friendly smile and asked how we were doing frequently without being too invasive. Overall it was a lovely experience. Go check them out!

I love CPK but tonight is not a good night for them. I came in at 7:00pm and theres a lot of people waiting. I get it, its Friday night and families don't want to cook or just want to start the weekend off. I'm standing near the door and noticed a booth that could fit a family of four and a table for two. It is now 7:37pm and we have not been seated with the 30 min estimated wait time and no one has been seated in these two tables.. for half an hour now!!! As I stand here, pregnant and hungry, they clear another booth that fits four and seat a couple (party of two) there.. But not at the table that seats two! There's clearly a large number of families here with kids.  End rant.. We have been seated and I'm ready to order!

Service was better this time around, so I'm going to give them another star.  We had the Korean BBQ Tacos for a starter, Mom ordered the Jambalaya, and I had trouble choosing what I wanted.  Mom assumed I was going to have a salad.  She was wrong.  To be honest, I was having one of those moments where you are hungry, but you have no clue what you want and nothing really hits you.  Eventually I went with the Chipotle Chicken Pizza. The tacos were ok, there are two on a plate so if you want to share with more people, you'll need to order more.  I don't know what it was about it that just didn't do it for me, but my mom seemed to really like them.  I don't eat Jambalaya (go on, gasp...), but Mom seemed to like it.  It is a huge portion, there is some in our fridge right now.  And they serve theirs with pasta, not rice.  The pizza... DELICIOUS!  Loved it and it hit the spot.  It just had lovely flavour... the chicken, the salsa... and the cilantro lime cream sauce was a great touch!  We ate it all... no left overs :). We did take a cheeky dessert home.  We ordered the Tiramisu, which we ate a couple hours later.  Mom didn't really like it, she said it tasted boozy... I think it tasted awesome!  I like my Tiramisu to have slightly more cream than cake soaked in espresso, and this was exactly that.  I think the espresso, the cake, the cream... all the right flavours, all the right ratios and great for a late night snack!

My wife and I wanted to have an afternoon date, and were on a tight schedule. There were a few mix-ups on the food (grilled chicken ciabatta sandwich), but Courtney and the Manager on duty made it right, and we walked away very satisfied.  Ask for fresh cut serrano chilies if you have a need for some heat - they also have habaneros as well.  This site has the right balance between casual ambiance, food, and location.  Thanks guys.

The food was great. Our particular server was great once she came to the table. My issue is with overall staff. Call me old fashion but I was really put off by this.  My 13yr old son opened the door for me and just as I am walking in a cook runs in front of me through the front door..not even a glance, no thank you or excuse me to my son.... I think okay...he is in a hurry...but right behind him comes a waitress that does the same exact thing???? I find it rude. At least my son was raised right.. Then the hostess is speaking to me about our party and the phone rings..mid conversation with me she picks up the phone and starts talking to another waiter/waitress that was calling in on their shift.  Food is good. But service is probably better at Mcdonalds.

I really would love to give this CPK a better rating because I love the food and usually the service; however, this location has the worst service. Maybe it's our timing, but each time we eat here, we get terrible service and end up leaving irritated. Disappointed.

My girlfriend and I went last night and were put on the list and told there would be a twenty minute wait. After seeing other parties that arrived after us get seated I went to ask what was going on and why we hadn't been given a table yet.  I saw that my name had been crossed off the list and was told "Oh yeah you're next" so I went outside to wait.  After waiting another 10 minutes another party for two was seated before us again so we left and went to eat some where else. Bottom line is CPK is a chain.  The food is decent but you can get the same quality and options at any other CPK or really any other decent restaurant.  I won't be back. Two stars because I know the food is ok and I can't paint all staff with the same brush.

We just visited this restaurant and overall service was fast and food was delivered hot and fresh.  The only two things that would have made this a five star was kids Alfredo was not tasty and the bread was not hot ( usually they are hot and fresh) So hopefully on our next visit we can see improvements.
Always a clean atmosphere with helpful staff. Food is great no matter what you order. This location has never failed to keep me coming back!

So this is a first time visit to a CPK.  I normally have low expectations when it comes to trendy pizza restaurants.  I prefer the smaller places and mom/pop pizza joints to be honest.  My friends recommended I try the BBQ Chicken Pizza.... To my surprise, it seemed like everyone around us was also ordering the same thing.  Now, I like my pizza pretty standard with tomato sauce, unless Im eating a white pizza.  But the tangy BBQ sauce along with the chicken was pretty dang tasty!  I can see how this can be a crave.   Pricing was cheaper than what I expected so this was a huge plus.  This CPK was very clean and service was on point.   Definitely going to explore CPK as an option in the future.... Im actually craving their BBQ Chicken Pizza now!

Ate at CPK and ordered the personal sized veggie pizza and salad combo.  The pizza had great flavor and the salad was fresh, crispy with a side of ceasar dressing.  There was real shavings of parmesan cheese in the salad which was a nice touch.  The food is quality, price point a touch high, but i would recomend this restaurant.
ewe go there in a large group of 12 to 14,  they have been very nice and getting us sitted in the short amount of time, food is very good,

The food is standard CPK quality and taste. But the service is below par of other CPKs. It seemed a bit dark inside, not a lot of lights turned on and the ceiling is painted black. It took awhile to even find a hostess to seat us. A cook on break was nice and he tried to find her. We also got the feeling some of the servers did not like their jobs. Not a lot of genuine  smiles. Got the feeling they were going through the motions.  Also saw they do not pitch in to help each other. Our server took a break to eat and went missing for awhile. We had finished and wanted our bill so se could pay and leave. My wife tried to wave down another server who actually saw her and made eye contact but he made a pissed off face and turned away (Caucasian dude with a light brown curly hair and scruffy beard). Then when he walked by again purposely avoiding eye contact. Wow nice job. Why didn't he just go home and not bother to come back.

So the last time I ordered takeout, the order wasn't right and we were missing the utensils I asked for (which was very inconvenient since we needed to eat in the car on the way to practice.) but I let it go that time because I've dines in several times and had good experiences.  Tonight, however, takes the cake. I ordered for curbside pickup and was out front and called at the designated time. 10 minutes passed and nothing. Called back, the same person realized that it was me calling again and goes "I'll take care of this myself." 7 minutes and nothing. So I get out and go inside, and the server's just coming out with my stuff. I pay inside and on my merry way. I'd figured the delay was due to my food not being ready so I figured well at least it'll be nice and hot! I get home 3 minutes later, the food is cold, dried, congealed. My fettuccini "extra sauce" - dried out with undercooked noodles. Not al dente. Undercooked. There appears to be about 2 ounces of spinach artichoke dip (see photo), which, mind you, costs $11!!!!!  Both pizzas need to be nuked, ruining the texture.  Ugh.

If you're on the go like me you'll love their curbside service! Call from anywhere, pick it up... Quick and on time! Artichoke Dip & Chips + Original BBQ chicken pizza with bacon + BBQ salad = my top 3 faves!
Average pizzas, average salads, average environment. Nothing special here.

it would have been a 5 if we have a consistent good service. The whole chain has great food, reasonable price. Thank goodness it has maintained that consistency. Unfortunately the service has started to decline especially this location as this is the closest to our house. Hit or miss: Wait time:  come earlier than 5PM for dinner or be prepared to wait for almost an hour or maybe more on the weekend.  Accommodation: it has become the hub of family gatherings with big groups of kids (teams, etc). and as expected, boisterous, loud combo of kids squealing + adult laughters just fills the air. Service: it depends on who you get. Hope a veteran wait staff will get your order as it will be efficient and precise, drinks filled automatically. Otherwise, you will get someone who seemed to have been lost between getting the bread or figuring out the way back to your table.  Overall experience: Pick your day and consider the hours when to come. On this location, avoid Friday and weekend dinners unless you want to eat before 5PM.

The food was great as per usual, however after the service that my family and I received today, I needed to update my review! Ross is an AMAZING waiter, he was very thoughtful, and knowledgable. He was very personable, and smiled a lot! My mother was indecisive on what to order, and he provided insight on the dishes offered at CPK, and suggested some of his favorites as well. Our drinks, appetizers, and food came out promptly, and he kept us updated on when they would be done and on its way to our table. Excellent customer service! :)

I have only been to 2 CPKs ever, this one and another in OC, but this time the experience was far below of what I expected. I had to ask for a new cup twice since it was dirty around the mouth area. Then the bread that normally comes out before the app/entree came after the entrees came. The only positive thing about this visit was the Chinese Chicken salad. It was fantastic and tasted amazing.
This is a popular place in the area.  Service is great, but I find the food to be average.   We often do take out here with my office,  and it is very convenient.

Please note that this rating is for this visit only. I would normally give them 4 stars. I was excited to try their fire grilled rib eye which is a new menu item. 40 minutes later, out came a burnt steak and a burnt carrot to boot. I understand that things happen, but I was very unhappy with the way the manager handled my concern. He basically said, "the front part (of the steak) looks good". He also insinuated that I ate some of the steak. Granted, I did take ONE bite to see if I could get myself to eat it (I hate wasting food) but it was too dry. He said he wouldn't charge me for it...... Wow, really??
Had my 3rd and last poor experience with Sofia working behind the bar, expect slow bar/drink service, with Unprofessional-ism. Food there is what should be expected at CPK.

Okay so came here with a few friends. We had kiddos and we came before it was super busy. Our waitress was kind of all over the place. She messed up our drink orders, and forgot my daughter's dinner. Normally, I would give this a whopping one star. However, the manager swooped in and saved the day. She did comp the meal and give us free dessert. I will say to really look at your bill because they did try to charge us for extra food we never asked for. It took the waitress going to the manager three times before it was fixed. Needless to say, a 45 min dinner turned I to almost 2 hours! The manager was nice and she did come out and apologize. I will not be back because it was too much anxiety to deal with the bill and the food was sub-par.

Love the Waldorf salad and the kids cheese pizza is great, there are def some gems here, I have no problem with the food and overall selection....the service tho is severely slowwwwww.  Makes it tough when I'm out with 3 kids. First slow to get bread, then slow to get food and now I'm seriously waiting longer then I ever had for my CC back/bill. Ridiculous.

Although I've been to other CPK's in the past and have had good experiences, I was less than impressed on this visit. This was stop number six on my boyfriend's Veteran's Day free meal circuit. We arrived around 4:45 and had a 20 minute wait for a table.  As I had been snacking at all the previous restaurants, I wanted something light and decided to try the Crispy Mac and Cheese off the small plates menu. Unfortunately, this dish was not what I was expecting. I thought it would be a small bowl of mac and cheese with the panko crust on the top for a bit of crunch. I didn't expect it to be fried mac and cheese bites. There was way too much breading and not enough mac and cheese. In fact, the bites seemed rather dry and desperately needed more cheese sauce. I managed to eat one before being overwhelmed by the breading and decided to get the rest to go for my boyfriend to eat. At least the dish was under $4 but it wasn't even worth that. My boyfriend, however, loved his complimentary for Veteran's Day pear and gorgonzola pizza.  I'm sure there are lots of great things on the menu but the mac and cheese small plate is not one of them.
Horrible customer service and very slow. Not engaging enough with guest didn't remember our orders and waiting almost 40 minutes for our checks.

Skipped out on lunch because I knew I was going to eat here for dinner. By the time it was dinner time, I was craving fatty food.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken w/Applewood Bacon PIZZA. When the server brought out my pizza...there was NO BACON :( I'm not a huge bacon fan, but this night I was craving the fatty meat. Luckily the server offered for a side of bacon so I accepted.  Overall, the food here is mediocore. Service was okay too. My pizza was almost $14 bucks. Don't think it's totally worth it. But, not a complete regret either. *BY THE WAY, if you go online to their website and sign up, you get a $5 off coupon!!

I love cpk! Best place for salads and pizza! Some say its pricey but its not bad to treat yourself once in a while. The only thing i get here is the caramelized peach salad with salmon. Its really good! And their moscato is pretty good also.

My boyfriend and I are both in the restaurant industry, so going to restaurants has become a challenge because we have become so critical of service, food and overall experiences. Honestly we hadn't found a nice restaurant to dine at until we entered this California pizza kitchen. We were both extremely impressed with the overall experience we encountered. When entering we were greeted by a smiling Hostess who sat us immediately and informed us that our waitress was a little busy, but she asked us for our drink orders. Our waitresses name was Brooke, I think, and she was lovely, helping us decide what we should drink and got our orders in very quickly.  We could tell she was busy but she was still so attentive and got us what we needed, when we needed it. The food came out at a perfect pace and I was extremely impressed by the quality of the food, and finding out you had gluten free pizzas as well was an awesome wow factor that helped me in the decision to come back again.  I could go on and on about how lovely this restaurant is but you HAVE to go try it out for yourselves! Thank you California pizza kitchen!

If I could give this no stars I would. My husband and I have been going here for years but last nights dinner was horrible. I had the tequila chicken fettucine that had one piece of a pepper in it and a few chicken bits that were no bigger than a penny.  My husband had the spaghetti bolognese and said it was the worst spaghetti he has ever had. Also, the table next to us asked if they changed the recipe to the mac and cheese because their child said it was yucky and wouldn't eat it. We won't be back.

This place is great for those that want something like pizza but not your typical pizza. It has some great flavors like gorgonzola and pear flatbread with balsamic yummy! The split pea and lentil soup was really hearty and the quinoa and apple salad is one I'll order again and I'm not a quinoa fan!  The wait can be long on busy nights but once your seated you'll see it was worth it!

Two or three stars.. Food was ok. Service wasn't bad.. My drink.. Was sad! See my above photo... Ordered a sangria.. Got half a glass of sangria, a lot of ice.. And some fruit on top.. Asked the manager about it. His response was.. "We use a measuring glass to make sure it's 8 ounces.. It's a big glass that's why we use ice and fruit". I told him I get it but I don't see a full glass of sangria.. I see a waste of $9. He didn't say much.. But my waitress did bring me a little "extra" sangria.. As I'm writing this review.

Tried this again a couple of weeks ago.  So happy to say that everything looked sparkling clean.  :-)  They offered a great combo lunch and services was fast/friendly.  Much improved and looking forward to our next visit.

I always love coming to CPK because the restaurant is clean and the staff is friendly. Not to mention, the food is always high quality and I enjoy the interesting and different pizza topping combinations. I decided to try something new for Veteran's Day (I could get a free pizza for being in the National Guard) and ordered the Pear and Gorgonzola thin crust pizza. Although I was a little weary of the pears because I'm not usually a fan of fruit on pizza but they weren't too overpowering and they complemented the pizza well. When the pizza arrived, it looked like a pizza with a salad on top. This surprised me but the salad was a touch and I gobbled up the arugula with gorgonzola salad quickly. After I finished my surprise salad, I started on the delicious pizza. Along with the pear, it was topped with caramelized onions, hazelnuts and gorgonzola. All the flavors combined perfectly to make a wonderful pizza that I highly recommend. Luckily, I had about 3/4 of the pizza to bring home and it reheated well, making for a great lunch at work this week.
Great service from Chris. Love their Thai Crunch salad. Definitely add the avocado to it. Yum!

I haven't been here in years, but the last time I was here I remembered it being pretty good. I had a gift card to this place, so I figured I would try it out again, this time for takeout. I ordered online, and there was a deal for a free small plate registering for their loyalty program. I registered and printed out the offer. When I got there, there were two people in front of me and one takeout register. The first person was doing a bunch of scratchers with the cashier for 5 minutes. The 2nd person had all these questions about the loyalty program and the CPK app that took 10 minutes, and then she left when her table was ready. W.T.F.  Finally it was my turn.
