I handed the cashier my coupon for the free small plate, she got my order ready, then I paid and left. I look at the receipt, and the cost was $5 more than I thought it would be. I realized she had forgotten to deduct the small plate, so I went back in. Only the takeout cashier could help me, so I had to wait for her once again. By that time there were 3 new people there, but they were nice enough to let me go back to the front. When I asked the cashier about the free small plate, she was a bit annoyed (and probably stressed from the number of waiting people) and told me I needed the printout. I told her it was the first thing I gave her. She looked around and found it, rang up the register and gave me $3.81. I showed her the receipt that the small plate was $5. Confused, she did something on the register and gave me the right amount.  When I got home, I found that the small plate was ridiculously small, as were the pizzas. I had also asked for bread for 4, and I got 3 small slices of bread. I guess this is what the disciples felt like when they had to feed the 5,000. Taste wise everything was fine, but value-wise it was awful. Next time I get a gift card to CPK I will probably regift it.

Amazing BBQ chicken pizza. They have a nice variety of pasta as well with gluten-free options. The staff was friendly but they took forever, I mean forever, to prepare our food. The last time I went there, there was a disgusting, vile smell in the bathroom though.
Really tasty Italian food here! I love coming here. Everything is really good. Only problem is they don't give you enough food

Various assortment of pies. Big draw for my wife and I are the salads. Salads are well put together, VERY BIG and VERY TASTY!  Place seems to be always busy, which is a good sign. Seating is quick- most of the time no waiting. Staff is extremely courteous and polite!

Every now and then the urge will strike me to go to CPK.  Today my husband & I met for lunch 30 minutes too early to allow us to grab Thaigo...so I suggested CPK.   I've been to this location about a dozen time and it's always clean & the staff is always friendly.  I have gotten the Cobb salad, the Thai chicken salad, a few pizzas, amd a pasta dish, that frankly was so memorable, I can't remember what it was.  The food is always decent...but that is about as far as I can take it.  Decent as in, I'd rather come here than go to Chevys or TGIF Fridays.   My husband and I are on an undeclared mission to still enjoy eating out while sticking to our new wallet busting budget.  We opt for sharing items to keep cost down and in turn have taught ourselves to eat less too.  Isn't that a win-win?  Anyway, today we chose to split a jerk chicken pizza. The good: we both got 3 pieces of pizza and were stuffed at the end of lunch, the pizza had a nice little kick to it, the ingredients were fresh and it was a very colorful dish...you eat with your eyes first. The bad: I do not have a sweet tooth what so ever.  I will always choose savory over sweet.  With that said, the sauce that was used on the pizza was WAY too sweet for my liking. The spicy finish was the only thing that kept me eating.  The great: hubby & I shared a pizza, drank water & left full for $14.01.  Nice!

Stopped in here before heading to Stone Brewery for a tour. Standard CPK menu. Friendly wait staff. Hostess sat us away from everyone so my BFFs little boy (8 months) wouldn't be in the way in his GIANT jogger stroller. =) Service was good. Lunch was ready in no time (2 pizzas and a salad). Refills kept coming without having to ask.

Amazing food and always supports our school's fundraising activities. Our school repeatedly has the highest totals at this restaurant because the parents love it so much. They have donated thousands to our school and bent over backwards for us. Thanks CPK!!!  Oh and they have catered our teacher luncheon too. It was insanely good!

For all the fanfare the overall food experience left me flat. We came for an office lunch and enjoyed ourselves with the camaraderie. The food on the other hand was just okay, especially for the price.  I had the carnitas taco plate. The tacos were a little thin on the carnitas, and the flavor decidedly not authentic Mexican. This falls into the Rubios camp of watered down Mexican food.  Some others had the fettuccine, pizza,  and sandwiches. As we were leaving, our conversation turned to how everything was typical Americanized renditions of ethnic foods.  If the company is good, this place is good enough. I just wouldn't seek to return here for the food.

I stopped here for quick snack and happy hour. I was very impressed by my server Sarah. She was really pleasant that suddenly changed my perception of an all american chain. Even though there were nothing special about the food, it could still be a great experience

A young lady named Cierra did a great job for us at CPK. Cierra made the experience at this restaurant something that management should be proud of. She was very polite, funny and always made sure our experience was satisfying. We ate the Sicilian pizza that was slightly spicy and added great flavor to the main course! Do not miss out on the butter cake for desert. One of the best dishes I have ever had.

I had never been there before and apparently as a welcome to new customers, they give you a free starter. Cool! We had the famous BBQ Chicken and the Pepperoni, Sausage and Mushroom, and a Cobb salad. The pizza was a tad on the small size and they only have one size, but the quality was good. Very fresh and hot out of the oven. The service was great, too! The free bread and oil while you wait was definitely a plus, too. I will definitely be returning to CPK!

I am not a huge fan of CPK.  For the price of one of their pizzas, you can often get a large from a typical chain or mom/pop store.  You go for the more "gourmet" pizza, I guess.   I actually went with a very unusual pizza today- the veggie pizza.  I asked to get it with no red onions, but our waiter informs me that they got put on anyway and would they like me to wait for a new one.  I say no worries but I was surprised nothing got knocked off the tab- at least an offer of something or whatever, but no, just a quick apology.   Not a great pizza, either.  Especially not for $12.  But they did have a tasty red wine sangria.  And the appetizer Tex-Mex egg rolls are all right.  Our Caesar had little dressing. So, fuck it.  Go somewhere else.  :)

It's CPK.  It's the typical restaurant chain.  The food will usually be the same, so if you haven't been here, you should at least check it out. This CPK was clean, well lit, and the service was good. We got the meat lovers and the habanero carnitas pizza.  The carnitas came with a habanero salsa on the side and you just drizzle it on top of your slice (good way of controlling the spice).  I liked the salsa a lot and asked for another one because it wouldn't have been enough. Limited alcohol selection (mainly beer), so don't come here looking for a good beer.

We come to CPK pretty often since it's so close to our house and we love their salads. The other night we went in and got amazing service from Allison. She was quick to bring out our bread, appetizer and drinks. She also brought refills without us having to ask for them. She was all around a great server and made our visit very pleasant. Thank you Allison!

4 stars for their food, because it is tasty, because the chain is pretty consistently tasty, and I absolutely love their Thai Crunch salad. The 5 star review is for the service.  I went here with 21 friends for my husband's birthday last Sunday.  First of all, they were perfectly fine letting us make a reservation for 6:30 for 22 people (unlike Olive Garden across the street, who would only make a reservation for 5pm or earlier...).  The server was prompt in getting us drinks and did a pretty good job of refilling them, especially for the amount of people we had. I ordered an appetizer and it was forgotten, not a big deal, I hadn't even realized that I didn't get it until I received my entree.  I asked the server to take it off the bill, and she apologized for it and assured me it would be taken off.  Then the manager came over and apologized, and then they returned with a doggy bag containing the appetizer and gave it to me for free.  I just didn't want it on my bill, so they really went above and beyond service-wise.  They also split the bill without asking, which is awesome for a big group. They definitely proved that they could handle a big group and maintain good service, so we'll be back for another group dinner there.
Barbecue chicken salad is awesome.  I had that with their new mango strawberry drink, perfect mate afternoon lunch!

We LOVE CPK!  This CPK is like the other CPK locations we've been to - excellent food, top-notch friendly and professional service.  I'm still kind of pissed off at them for taking my favorite carne asada pizza off the menu, but they made up for it by adding the habanero carnitas pizza.  It's always nice when we go on vacation and stay at a hotel within walking distance of CPK so we can also partake of some of their tasty cocktails, too.

This CPK is a bit better than most chain restaurants.  On our last visit, we were seated promptly, visited quickly by our waiter, and our food came in a decent amount of time.   Husband had the creamy garlic fettucine with shrimp - he said it was very good and I noticed a good portion of fairly large shrimp.  I had the spinach/artichoke thin crust pizza - also good - just what I wanted. Extra points for our waiter (Cris) who, when I was searching for a smaller salad, suggested the arugula/asparagus small plate.  Just right. Wine selections are okay. The biggest negative about CPK (this or any other) is that it feels like a chain - while the noise and ambiance are average, it doesn't not exude any personal warmth.  That's the trade-off, I guess.
Seating, service and food were slow tonight and our water stayed empty. Normally, this location provides a better dining experience for the family. Our kids do love the pasta kids meal.

I am a veteran and this is the second year I have visited CPK to participate in their free offering for Veteran's Day. I was impressed last year by their generosity as they offered an entree free to each veteran who visited the restaurant on 11/11, quite a contrast to the free cup of coffee offered by many businesses. I was even more impressed today when each server/staff person I came in contact with greeted me and thanked me for my service. In each case, the person made direct eye contact and communicated their personal gratitude and recognition with a genuineness that touched me. The CPK environment as a whole was welcoming and appreciative and conveyed a sense of honor as they served meals to those who have served. This is a business which is doing justice to Veteran's Day in every way!!
They consistently forget to put things in a takeout order like forgetting to put chicken with a salad or the dressing.

We are now officially regulars here. We love all of the food choices and full bar; something for everyone, really! We really like the staff here; they always go out of their way (no we're not related to anyone here) to make sure our experience is a good one.  A special shout out to Taylor and Kevin who work the host stand a lot of weekend nights with grace and style and always manage to fit our party in without too ridiculous of a wait-time. Jeff (the manager) always makes an effort to stop by the table and say hello just because we do visit so often; at least 1x/week. We love this place and we think you will too!

Lunch at California Kitchen...food was excellent...basic club sandwich and tortilla soup for me and a salad for my wife followed by her favorite...pumpkin cheesecake!  Awesome service by Lindsay was a highlight!

We waited for an hour to eat, and when our food came it was cold and disgusting.  The toilet in the women's bathroom is absolutely deplorable. The hostess was rude and didn't even look us in the eye. We were also given huge spoons for our salad. And had no silverware on the table. And there was a hair baked into our crust. Very unorganized.

When do you give someone another chance? After two years!  Yes, I ventured back into the Carmel Mountain CPK after turning my back over two years ago. This time it was different because of a great host/server from Missouri named Jeff, a real southern gentleman, soft-spoken, smiling guy who made all the difference.  Not only did he make frequent trips to our booth, checking on us, he also gave us space when needed.  But, above all, he talked nice and his voice had a genuine tone of kindness and caring timbre! Also, that being a Sunday night, and the restaurant not spilling with humanity, made a difference in the kitchen.  Our BBQ Chicken pizza had a sweet barbecue flavored chicken cubes and red onion on soft bread,  yummy as we would have expected.  The kitchen could, however, have used a little bit more cilantro; the few cilantro bits were okay for the presentation, but failed to do much for for the taste buds!  My kids had a Cheese and a Pepperoni--the usual.   My Sam Adam paired well with my pizza dinner which we topped later with a Brownie with a dollop of cream on top (for my kids), Vanilla ice cream and a Red Velvet cake.  I'm stuffed! This time was "now" and so different from "then." "Then" was the time, a time over two years ago, when the server was an uninterested local teen, the pizza had rubber pieces for chicken, and it took ages to get water or give order, or get food.  Yes, it was then.  The experience meter had dipped so low into the basement that I could not bother myself to write for one star.  It was then! But, now, it's a new sun with bright SoCal sunshine.  As long as the likes of Jeff remain the sunny face of CPK, I will keep coming back.

Seated within 10 minutes had three different pizzas the margarita pizza crust was nice and thin just like I like it, the pepperoni pizza my son ate almost by himself, my husband tried the white pizza with bacon which he loved but I felt was an ok pizza it was the margarita pizza which I felt was the best out of the three, drinks were constantly filled, the 4 different dessert that we had were amazing the butter cake topped with ice cream was divine if your not in the mood for chocolate, my son had the chocolate soufflé that looked like a lava flow and the tiramisu was fabulous and the salty Carmel pudding was a perfect blend of sweetness. We couldn't help trying each other's dessert  and the service and waitress attention was outstanding. Will be back.
I will never go to this CPK again.  My wife and I ended up getting food poisoning from this CPK!

Great food, good atmosphere, very cool people (this location hires good people who can socialize and hang out and carry a conversation) I like a place that I can hang out and chat about sports, holidays, and what not!... The gourmet style pizzas rock and so do the salads!
Good food. Service is slower but worth the wait
I just ordered two of the asparagus arugula salads to go and they were super tinny! They  were about $6 each! And they only gave me three pieces of bread! WHAT A RIP-OFF!

Came here for an early lunch with the girls and it was entirely empty except for a small party of 3.  So obviously service was attentive.  As a matter of fact, our server was begging us for more things to do. Because of the artichoke we tried at Azul ( ) we decided to try the fried artichokes off their Small Cravings menu.  Let's just say BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!  First of all, they probably gave us just 6 tiny pieces (so THAT'S why they call it SMALL Cravings!  ) with a not-so-wonderful dipping sauce.  What a waste of $3. I also ordered their grilled veggie sandwich which was fabulous!  the portobello mushroom was meaty enough that you couldn't tell there were only veggies in this baby.  I only wish it came with another small side in addition to the soup, salad, or slaw they offer.  But my tortilla soup was creamy and delish, btw!

I'm giving this 2 stars because our server was fantastic, not because the restaurant is particularly memorable.  My boyfriend and I were looking for a mellow dining experience. I wanted menus and no plastic cutlery, so we settled on CPK. We were seated quickly and the hostess had no problem letting us sit at a nearby booth instead o our original table. We're off to a good start! Our waitress rocked. Friendly, attentive, and accommodating she really made an effort. I was dismayed though to see CPK has weaned down their menu and my favorite menu items are now gone. Wheres my spaghetti with shrimp?!  We had the lettuce wraps to start and I was dismayed to see they send a measly 3 leafs of lettuce. Many restaurants will provide what amounts to almost half a head of lettuce. 3 leaves? For $8?? I gave the 3rd leaf to him and just used my fork for the remaining portion of filling. The sauce provided was also lacking in both flavor and zing. I ordered the tomato and basil pizza with thin crust, and was shocked when it arrived at my table and what looked like globs of TOMATO PASTE were haphazardly thrown on my pizza. I know the cheese and tomato pizza includes nice slices of roma tomatoes, I assumed mine would also but nope! Globs of dried out and sad looking tomato paste. The basil was fresh however, and I was offered more Parmesan and black pepper, but thats more kudos for my server and not for the restaurant. An appetizer, 2 adult beverages, and 2 pizzas ran over $50. The staff were all awesome, but the menu changes, high prices and meager portions and preparation all mean  wont' be back for a lonnnnnnnnnng time, if ever.

omg!!! i've had the blt pizza 50 times at other stores....but they tried to sell me one at half the size at this location. this store is ripping off the public! it was 8 inches wide, 5-6 little pieces of bacon, flat and dried out, for over $15...and they wanted me to put my own toppings on!!! avoid this store!

They just redecorated in there, and it looks absolutely great in there!  I love the new "vibe!"  Also, have had a new server in there a few times recently, and she has done a great job for us, so we always ask for her now. KT.  Ask, and you'll be glad you did!
Their take out service is disorganized and understaffed! If you can't provide the service, don't make believe you provide the service!

I have not been to CPK in a long time.  The wife usually gets CPK from the Pharma Reps.  We decided to eat here since we were running errands in the area.  Not much has really changed since the last time I dined here.  One thing that did change and is quite refreshing is the complimentary bread.  I am not sure when they changed this, but you actually get better sourdough bread now instead of that bland white bread/butter.  However, you still only get 1 extra piece of bread in addition to the size of you party.  In this case, we got 3 small pieces of bread for 2 people.  I appreciate and understand not wasting food, but I think one piece per person is not enough.  How about five pieces of bread for a party of two?  Anyways, the food and service were decent and we had a great lunch.

Yea, Yea.. It's CPK. But let's just be honest. It is literally one of my favorite chain restaurants. I mean, when I was in high school, I think we probably kept the one in the Natick Mall open. Nothing like huge pieces of bread with a whole pad of butter on top. ... and then pizza... and then dessert... On a rainy Saturday night, the Carmel Mtn location was packed. But we found seats at the bar to pass the 30 mins. I ordered a strawberry margarita. It was blended (awesomeee). The bartender gave me a huge glass for it, AND he gave me all the leftovers in another glass. Basically got 2 drinks for one. Then, through dinner, I had two more. So sue me! Awesome bartender. Thanks, man! He was kinda cute, too... drink prices are great here, also. Cuz it's the boonies? I dunno. I had the BLT pizza. Because I ALWAYS have the BLT pizza. Except when I'm skinny. Which is clearly not now. So. I had the BLT pizza. AMAZEBALLS.  At the bar, I noticed a picture of a slice of Red Velvet cake on the front of the dessert menu. I thought... they must be lying. It's a fake out. Well.. I clearly hadn't eaten enough after all the bread and all the blended marg and all the pizza, so.. I asked. Do  they really have Red Velvet cake? Oh yea, they sure do. And it's GOOD.  The Red Velvet is not made in-house. They get it from a distrubutor. The best part is.. you can order a whole cake THROUGH CPK to take home. Not kidding! CPK, keep it up. I think I love you. No, No.. I KNOW I love you.

I used to love this spot specially for their Pizza... Now the pizza is not crispy and it's just ok, we order a jambalaya pasta which I think is good at least they have something good in the menu... However our service was great but we where hearing complaints from so called restauranteur that her server was ignoring her demands, kinda fishy cos the floor manager comp her food... Not sure if that was a con to get free food, but what do I know :/  All I can say is this spot is not as it used to be for me...

The pizza here is phenomenal. My advice is to get the California club pizza, it's my favorite. The atmosphere inside is always great but I liked the outdoor patio where I could relax and cool off on a hot day. The service was great and refilled my drink very fast. I got in and out quickly since I was in a hurry but it was a great place.

Came in for the first time last night, an hour before closing. Even though it was late, they were very friendly and our waiter was both talkative and attentive. They even brought us a sample bowl of their soup on the house! The pizzas aren't very big, maybe 1 or 2 would feed 2 people, but that was perfect because our party was able to try a bunch of different pizzas! My favorite was the California Club which had lettuce, avocado, bacon, and a great creamy dressing on it. The veggie pizza was not my favorite because I'm not a fan of the sun dried tomatoes and the crust was the tiniest bit undercooked. Overall loved this place and will definitely come back--I wish it was closer to my house!

Love the BBQ chicken pizza. I've tried to store brand and it's just as good.  So when you are actually eating at the restaurant, order something else.  Thai chicken pizza, good!  Tequila pasta, good! Kung pao spaghetti, good!  So what I'm trying to say, is that the pasta is just as good as the pizza.   Maybe the name should be California Pizza/Pasta Kitchen?

I love this place! Their food is always amazing and the staff has always been very nice and attentive to each table. The reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it is very pricey for a family resteraunt in carmel mountain ranch. This is not a fancy place however it is charging pretty steep prices

What happened to this place? It used to be better - as recent as a couple months ago. We stopped by last night for take out. Ordered a grilled vegetable salad, Kung Pao spaghetti w/chicken, and a margherita pizza. $42 should buy some decent take out, don't you think? The salad was mostly lettuce, the Kung Pao was void of any vegetables and it was literally without a single peanut! How is that Kung Pao? Beats me... The only saving grace was the pizza, which was just OK, but we could have had a better meal from Domino's for $6.99. Was it just a bad day? New management? Who knows? CPK has gone way downhill in my book.

Two stars for the food & not the service! Terrible experience here. Waited for the front of the resto person for I'd say a good 15 minutes. We looked like idiots cause we weren't sure whether or not we should  find our own seats or what! And, it wasn't even busy!! A total of 5 servers passed by us and not even one extended any regard. Ridic!

I am a BIG fan of this restaurant! I may not have the time to sit and eat all the time, however, I ALWAYS order for take out and they are very accomodating. Curbside pick up is great for when you want to just grab your togo order without leaving your car. They are always ready and prompt on the time they say your food will be ready. It is a nice place to sit and eat, not too fancy or anything, which i like, because you can have a causual "catch up" lunch date with a friend or significant other and just enjoy quality food! There are many items on the menu that are delicious that come to mind, however, Some entrees that i suggest on trying are: BBQ Chicken pizza Pesto Chicken Pizza Asparagus & Spinach Spaghettini *But my ALL time favorite: Chicken Tequilla Fettuccini!! --if you are going to order this dish, I suggest ordering it with their "thin spaghettini" noodles! Let it soak in the sauce for a couple minutes after you get it, i promise its worth it! The noodles soak up the sauce and its HEAVENLY! The pasta is creamy, limey, and flavorful! I suggest joining in on the addiction!

Came here for Easter as the fam didn't feel like cooking and there weren't a whole lot of places opened. The food is pretty tasty, the atmosphere is great, but it bugs me that they keep changing their menu and that their prices keep going up. Their pizzas are really good, but they now range from $11-$14. Ridiculous! Especially given their size! I really like their spinach artichoke dip, but it gets cold really fast and becomes one big lump of oily cheese. Their desserts are amazing... I personally recommend the butter cake, tiramisu, and salted carmel pudding (try it, it's good!).

Went here last night and we both really liked our pasta.  We both had the Fusilli with Broccoli and Sun Dried Tomato and the flavor was really good...but, GASP!...the pasta was not al dente! ...a tad overcooked.  A grave Italian sin!  I eat here every now and then and usually the pasta is perfect.   For this reason, I am  going to show them some mercy and give them a total break by giving them 4 stars, not three...I have to be fair.  :)  But hoping they watch the pasta going forward.  In the past, I have also had their salads and pizzas and they are really good...consistently.   Now, in the interest of full disclosure, you should know that though I am not a food snob in general, I AM a tiny bit of an Italian food snob.  Ok, a LOT of one.   I know my Italian.  So while this place cannot begin to compare with true Italian cuisine, it is pretty good for what it IS...an American chain.      As for the service, it was really good.  We were seated right away...though we did get there a little late...way past the dinner rush...so I would expect that I suppose.  FYI, there is usually a wait around the lunch and dinner rush.   Our server was really nice and did a great job of balancing good service (taking care of us) with leaving us alone and letting us have our conversation and fun without much interruption...and her timing with the check was perfect.      There is a lot of seating, as in most CPK's, and the usual decor....cool, crisp, colorful and well-lit.  Really like this place overall.  :)

CPK is really just ok.  The prices are high, and each time I am somewhat underwhelmed by the food quality.  If you're going to dine here, either have the kids mac and cheese, which is the best thing on the menu or the cedar plank salmon.

So...They have some gluten free options, but you have to specifically ask for them.  I tried the Tortilla Soup (without the Tortilla Chips), but somehow, it seems that Tortilla Chips still made it into the soup.  The table that we had seemed to be off balance, so I asked the waitress to fix it.  She promptly handed me one of the smaller menus, told me that they fit perfectly into the gap on the rocking table and promptly walked away!!  The food took very long to arrive and frankly was nothing to cheer about.
You'll never be too excited to be here, but you'll be satisfied with your lunch everytime.

We always enjoy coming to CPK in Carmel Mountain.  It's close to the movie theater and convenient to our home.  The food is consistently good (I'm a big fan of the chicken picatta) and my wife loves the carmelized peach salad and the apple-berry sangria.  It's always very busy when we go but they are efficient and we've never been late to a movie because of them.

So, my sister gave me a gift card for here this last Christmas and we figured we should just use it. It's a free dinner after all.  We ordered a Caesar salad and as I am about halfway through it, I discover a good-sized fly in it. We told our waitress, and it was taken off our bill.  As for the pizza: It was really mediocre. I think that a frozen pizza from the grocery store would have almost tasted better.  Service was so-so. I'm really glad that they didn't make us pay for our fly salad though. It really makes you wonder how well the cooks wash the vegetables back there.  I don't think i'll be returning.

100% recommended. Their artichoke spinach pizza is just amazing. Plus the customer service was great. All of our food had arrived to the table however my daughters pizza never showed up. We told the waiter and he apologized that another waiter had taken the order by mistake. He them brought is her pizza, removed the item from the bill and comped us out appetizer. All of this without us even complaining.

Nicely diverse menu though I always seem to end up ordered one of their many pizza choices.  Very consistent service and quality of food.  My wife really enjoys the variety of salads at CPK.  Highly recommended.

I ordered the "Mushrooms pepperoni sausage" pizza. It has 5 toppings Mushrooms, pepperoni, Italian sausage, Mozzarella and tomato sauce. On almost 1/2 the pizza there was no sauce.  The other 1/2 did not have any extra it's just like he forgot a second scoop.  I'm no cook but you take 5 ingredients and evenly distribute them evenly. Yea I complained to the manager who said let me order you a new one. Well who wants to sit in front of other people watch them eat and then make them wait 15 minutes and you eat in front of them. The manager did comp us two meals which I thank him for but when it comes down to it the manager should be the one doing the quality control in the kitchen and not at the register.
I like this one because the turn around time is faster than fashion valley CPK.  Plus the staff is more energetic and attentive

2 and a half stars actually - Busy busy busy are the busy bee workers here at this CPK.  They are packed to the brim on a Saturday night, a favorite for the locals here.  I called in ahead of time and put my name on the waiting list.  This cut our wait time down to 20 minutes which is a miracle since someone was quoted a 1-hour wait.  OMG.  We were seated in  a dimly lit corner under a tv.  It was slightly uncomfortable.  The artichoke dip was too salty.  The side Caesar salads were good though.  I ordered the half sized Thai Peanut Crunch salad which was missing the peanut sauce and was also under-dressed.  The bread and butter was plentiful however so I knew I wasn't going to starve or anything.  One person's linguine with clams was under-sauced and the same for someone's fettuccine Alfredo.  BBQ chicken pizza was still a crowd pleaser.  Thanks!

I took my husband out to CPK last year around July for his birthday. Needless to say we never went back. When we walked in it was mid afternoon and the place was dead, probably around 3 other customers. Although it was slow we still waited to be seated. Our server was "Alexiz" or so the bill said, she never really introduced herself. My husband had a pepperoni pizza (that they only kind he will eat) and I had soup (not a big pizza fan). 45 minutes later our food arrives.. by now we are pretty hungry and couldn't understand the wait when the other customers in the restaurant were already served and eating when we walked in. When the pizza arrived it was cheese and olives..not cheese and pepperonis. The waitress tells us that the kitchen screwed up and did we "mind eating it anyway?" Are you kidding me? Why try to serve something you already know is a mistake. My husband, not wanting to grouch on his birthday said that he would eat it. As he is eating the first piece he makes a horrid look and turns it over..it is burnt. I keep asking if he wants me to talk to the waitress. By now I'm pretty pissed. He says no, leaves money and we go. We have never been back since. Our bill was $38.07 (still have the receipt to this day in my pile of places never to eat from again.) for something we never got to eat. Ridiculous.

How disappointing!  CPK has many good menu options but stay away from the 'new' Mac n cheese.  This fusilli sits in semi-cheesy soup that tastes like a less flavorful Kraft Mac n Cheese.  I was given the option to order something else to be prepared quickly.  The salad from the small eats menu came after my lunchmate's meal was fully consumed.  I was charged for both meals.  Bad business.  Lucky for me there are  many better lunch options in the Carmel Mountain area.
I love CPK and this location isn't too bad. You may come across a lazy/rude waiter from time to time, but overall it's a great place to get an awesome salad, pizza, or quick bite to eat.

I went in for dinner last night, and found a sticker in my food. I told the bartender, and the manager came over to talk to me. I didn't ask for it to be comped, but he did for me. It was a small gester, but nice and unexpected. I will go back for sure.

A regular favorite. Over many years, I still get a craving for the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad... another favorite that came later is the sun dried tomato pasta (can't remember it's name, but I recognize it once I'm there...might be called sun dried tomato pasta?)
The food is so consistent and good. Exactly what you expect each time. Service ranges from ok to good. Enjoy the menu variety. I don't love chain restaurants but this one is a good one!
The manager Nick is excellent.  He took care of an issue promptly and fairly.  That is all you can ask for.
$30 for a full order BBQ Chicken salad with no taste, a bowl of soup for my wife and one Ice Tea. Not worth it.

Came in after 8:30 pm so it was not busy at all. Service was extremely slow.  It took the waiter 10 mins to come by to take order for drinks.  15 mins later still no water. Water came and he had to go drop off soda to another table.  10 mins he came back to take our order for food.  25 mins wasted we were ready to order as soon as we say down. So almost an hour later, we still hadn't order our food.  Our hope for quick dinner turned out to be a 2+ hrs event. Boo

CPK is definitely a place you take the kids to. They are decent and I have "the usual" when I go there. They have a rather large menu but I only like a few things on it. Their prices for a drink is a little high, which is why I don't even have a glass of wine when I go anymore. I really love their red velvet cake...oh my! All in all, the experience is exactly the same whenever we go...which is good. My daughter gets what she wants, and that works for us on the nights we want to take her out.

The food at CPK, as usual, is decent. Unfortunately, the waiter serving us at the Carmel Mountain location, Mark, was totally substandard. His attitude reared it's ugly head when he took offense at me sending something back to the kitchen because he messed up the order. I will travel the extra miles to bring my business to other CPKs like La Jolla or Fashion Valley. Thanks alot for ruining a previously enjoyable venue.

Went into tonight around dinner time 6 ish. Was expecting a couple minute wait due to the time we arrived. We walked in were sat immediately. Our server was very quick! Never had to ask for refills. Wonderful service and the staff is great! Will be visiting this CPK again in my future!

I have been going to CPK for years, and I have never had a bad experience! I go to the Carmel Mountain location at least once a week because it is the closest CPK, and there food is delicious! The staff at this location is very friendly too!

Their mini appetizer of the white corn guacamole is fantastic. I had the chipotle chicken pizza and my friend had the infamous bbq chicken pizza. Both were amazing. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is that our waitress was really bad at refilling drinks. Eating a spicy pizza really meant we needed refills and we were dying of thirst. :( If the place hadn't  been practically empty I could understand...

Not a good spot for lunch.  We had a party of 5 (heehee) and stood there and stared at all these empty tables???  Can't they at least seat us so we can wait sitting?  The entire experience took almost 2 hours.  It's as if I get 2 hours for lunch... is it French Pizza Kitchen?  Another time I was there with just one other person, and was seated a lot faster.  I don't understand though, because we were looking at a lot of empty tables... The pizza are over $12, and while there are some interesting choices, I don't know if it's really worth it.  The mango tandoori is pretty interesting in a good way, and so is the vegetarian one.  But when I feel like pizza, I think I want my margherita or hawaiian, which I can get for less than $10 anywhere else.  That on top of the service just doesn't entice me to add this place to the normal rotation.

Next shocking thing after seeing folks waiting in line at Olive Garden (oh, come on !), how popular this place was, and how bad the pizza was..it's not authentic type, some kind of fusion pizza ? (Thai pizza, in the menu).. That's bad pizza, bad Thai food...don't know what it is.

Monday night dinner. Arrived early evening to no wait and sat immediately.  Cpk is a occasional, but familiar place for our family to dine on pizza and pasta. The Sicilian and the chicken piccata are usuals and always consistent. Start off with a soup, this time split pea and half a Chinese chicken, all to share for a family of 2 adults and 2 kids and a baby who is starting to eat, so she gets the sauceless chicken from salad and some soup.  The only food complaint was that the salad looked smaller than usual, a bit wilted, but sparingly dressed the way a salad should be.  The service was as usual, off. This time the waiter seemed not yet awake, with a dose of short term memory. It wasn't too busy, but he had to be asked multiple times for things, silverware and napkins, and he turned around mid way out the kitchen to dish up soup to be sever with our salad, no big deal, apologized and forgiven.  Food came in timely manner from a runner and we were offered cheese and red pepper for our dinner which we accepted.  Halfway through the piccata, I toss the remaining pasta into sauce for distribution and a black, curly, ugly hair popped out, gross, I almost threw up in my mouth. We waived down the waiter, he immediately got the manager, she apologized, removed the item from bill, offered to make another, to eat now or pack for later, never making excuses. I kindly declined and she went further to offer dessert, I looked at my family to see if they were interested as I was no longer interested in eating, but she left the menu, told us to think it over and to let our waiter know. All very kind and all very professional and I have zero complaints about the way the situation was handled. Zero. The kids ended up deciding on the red velvet cake, it was ok, I make better. But all in all, it's too bad that I will mentally need to get over the hair thing before I can return, probably will be inspecting every bite for a while when I finally allow myself to return.

I usually really like CPK, but the buck stops here with this location. Their food is mediocore, which is expected at CPK, but the service is horrible and they have a serious parking situation on their hands.  If you're going to brave the parking lot AND the miserable hostess AND the nonchalant waiter....try the pear pizza and salad. At least that was good.  The next time I tried CPK, I called in my order so I didn't have to deal with the poor service. Again, I was extremely dissapointed. Not only was my order not ready, it was also incorrect. The person who got my order then proceeded to try and convince me that I wanted what they had and didn't want to wait for MY pizza. Needless to say, I wasn't impressed. I think I'd rather stick to Z-pizza around the corner rather than deal with the service at this CPK location again.

I love love love this CPK.  Okay, probably because it was one of the first dates I had with my now fiance, but hey.  Good memories. I really crave CPK pizza sometimes.  I love the Margherita and the BBQ Chicken.  They also have some FABULOUS salads (the one with the apple/pear and gorgonzola YUM). The place ain't cheap though.  We typically get 2 pizzas and a salad to share (having leftovers of course) but drop about $50. The place can get realllllly packed on the weekends too, so go early or really late.

I am surprised this place doesn't get better reviews, I mean yeah it's a chain restaurant but it has pretty good food.  The only problem with this review is I only eat one thing when I come here and that is the BLT Pizza on their honey wheat dough which is really nice tasting.  On top of the pizza is sliced tomatoes and lettuce that is mixed with some kind of mayonaise!  And don't forget the bacon, they use apple smoked bacon according to their menu and it is really crispy, not soggy like a lot of other places.  It was really good, but that is the only thing that stands out. As far as service and ambiance the place doesn't really stand out which is why I only give it 3-stars.  I mean, the waitress was ok but we had to ask her to refill our water glasses a few times.  I also had a glass of pinot and it was like 9 dollars and nothing special, I have no idea what brand they use or how long it has been aged.  The prices were average, a little on the pricey side for what you get.  I think they are ana verage restaurant that is trying to be fancy.  But, it's good if you try it out at least once because they do have a lot of interesting pizzas.

So it's been ages since I've been to CPK and while the food was decent, it is also quite pricey for what you get.  I mean seriously, it is a pizza!!   Went in on Friday night with a party of 7.  It was pretty crowded however our wait was only about 10 minutes so that wasn't too bad.   Once seated, our server was at our table immediately and took our drink orders.  Sam our server was very attentive throughout the meal and she would check back frequently to make sure that we had everything we needed. The one nice thing about CPK is that they offer many different choices, not only pizza.  As I said, it had been awhile since my last visit and their menu had changed in the meantime. Either it changed or I've gotten MUCH older and just don't have the memory I once had. The food itself was nothing spectacular but it wasn't where it stood out on the bad side either. So to the weird part of my meal.  As mentioned, we had a party of 7.  Well for most of the meal we had an 8th sitting at our table.  The table we were sitting at was booths on one side and chairs on the other.  At the table next to us was a young mother and her 2 y/o son.  Apparently the little boy found our table much more interesting than the going on's at his own table because without awareness, the boy was sitting at our table, practically on my daughters lap.  Cute circumstance? Perhaps.  As with anything however, things are better in moderation and I really wasn't expecting him to sit with us the entire meal.  The last I checked, we we not going to CPK to act as a babysitting service. I did make it clear to the mother that I was not picking up the check for him. Ok, I realize that really had NOTHING to do with CPK but it was too odd not to share. Back to the review; decent food, nothing great but in my mind overpriced.  Very good service though and for me that is a huge part of the battle.

Though this wouldnt be my first choice for a pizza joint when I think of pizza, I do love their "gourmet/unique" pizzas here.. The California Club tastes exactly like a club sandwich, its really very tasty. I would also rec the Roasted Garlic Chicken, perfectly "garlic-ky" and the chicken is very tender.  Their Works you cant go wrong with but honestly why would you order it when you can order that anywhere? The only pizza I wasnt fond of was the BBQ Chicken pizza (too overwhelming in the sauce it takes away from the overall taste) and the Thai Chicken- Idk what else to say but it is not even remotely close to being tasty. Soups are so-so but who comes here for the soup? I come here for the pizza!!!! The service we received were always great and fast, no complaints about that. And the prices is prety reasonable, unless you get the BBQ Chicken or the Thai Chicken. But then again, it's just my opinion..

Long wait for our party to get seated. Service was a bit slow and server was not very attentive. I had the famous BBQ chicken salad and I added avocado. CPK definitely has their cooks trained on portion control. My $13 salad had about 15 little chunks of chicken. Avo was about the same. The rest of the salad had no flavor. My wife even tried a bite and without hearing any comments from me said the same thing.

Miso Shrimp Salad, Margherita Pizza, and Spaghetti Bolongese..  Finish it off with a slice of red velvet cake with vanilla ice cream..  That's my usual when I come here and I'm always satisfied when I come out. The service is pretty good here.. most of the time the servers are very helpful and friendly.  The food comes fast and is always on point! My daughter had her first taste of bread here.. so this place is going to be memorable always! The restaurant is clean, well-lit.. and usually has a great customer-server ratio so you never really feel neglected. The bathroom has a changing table located in the handicap restroom stall.. it looked like it's cleaned on a regular basis, so it was questionable placing my daughter on it..  You know you'll see me here again and again!

Terrible service at the bar. Only two of us sitting there in between the lunch and dinner rush at 2:30 and this guy couldnt care less about serving me. No follow up, and blew off my second glass of wine requested so I had to recruit a waitress to pour. I felt like I was an inconvenience to my waiter. Very insulting.

CPK is one of the restaurant chains I enjoy visiting if I am out of my usual stomping ground of the greater NYC area. I was worried it was going to be packed on a Saturday night but we were told a 15 minute wait and were seated in about 5.  I had half a caramelized peach salad and that was tasty. We came to CPK because I told my friend I wanted Pasta-I almost ordered pasta but it seems kind of dumb not to get pizza when at CPK. The vegetarian was good-my friend has two of the small plates and they looked pretty tasty. We were asked by our server, runner and some sort of manager type (twice) how our meal was-I am wondering if this is in response to some of the reviews on here about the customer service.

Last night was a solid 4 stars! I ordered the wild mushroom pizza with goat cheese and truffle oil. WOW, it was amazing! The crust was burned on one side so the waitress told me a new one was in the oven but I got the (partial) burned one as well if I wanted. Perfect for leftovers! The waitress attention could be a little bit better, but overall a very good experience.

Been to CPK several times. The food is consistently good. The folks that work there are always courteous and act like they are happy to see you. If you don't like where they seat you, (noisy kids, AC blowing on you), they will move you without any issues.  The Avocado Club Egg Rolls are the best appetizers on the menu. Cobb salads are good as well. Pizza's are always good. I just tried the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine for the first time. It was very good and low on calories. Oh, the Dakota Smashed Pea + Barley soup is a must for me every visit.

I've never been to a CPK until a few weeks ago. My fiancé brought me here and it was very good. The customer service was fantastic and the food was great. We even had dessert which were these donut things and they were freaking out of this world DELISH! I loved the outside seating too very cute and would be fun to host a birthday party there. We will be back for sure

When you think of CPK pizza is usually what comes to mind but I love the salads here. They have a great caesar salad dressing. Put some grilled chicken on top of the salad and you're good to go. Get the side of bread so you can sop up the remainig dressing. My fiance and his mom love the salads here too.  The pizzas are great too and the bread sticks are finger licking good. You can order and pay your food on-line (and customize it), then call when you get there and they will bring the food out to you.
Best pizza and pasta around!If you are new you cant go wrong with a the classic BBQ chicken pizza they pioneered!Staff is very attentive and friendly!

I am not going to get all hyper positive or negative here about the place. It is a clean store, standard offerings, reasonable off-peak wait times. OK. What I am here to report is that this new menu calorie reporting law is really kinda useful. I always liked the BLT pizza there, now I know why: it is probably the lowest calorie thing on the menu and tastes good. Standard cheese pizza is actually listed as lowest at 998, but the sat fat is much higher. Their official menu says the regular dough BLT is 1,320 cals, and the Honey-Wheat Whole Grain is 1,300; 8 g fiber vs. 15 g; 52 g protein vs. 56. I have had both breads, they are really pretty equivalent to me. Just a little more bran-y mouthfeel to the whole grain. Here is the trick though: The waiter says the lettuce is tossed into like 4 tablespoons of mayo before it is applied to the pizza. That's 57 cals per tbsp, or 228. Ask for mayo on the side and light lettuce, +Honey Wheat. You are now talking about a medium pizza that is really right around (if not below) 1,000 cals, hi-pro, low sat fat and half a tomato. Split it with a friend and you are getting out of there with a intermediate-pro sub-500 cal meal for about $5.50 ($10.98/2). That tastes good. That is pretty cool. Note that if you are a sodium freak, this has as much salt as anything with bacon on it. This bacon is fresh and crispy and almost all meat. No worries that they may have chosen the cheap back-fat bacos.

I will never go to Carmel Mountain Ranch CPK again. Two bad experiences in one month. The service here is way below average no matter how busy they are. On-line ordering/Pickup is horrible too. I waited out in my car for 15 minutes and had to go inside to get it. While there I had to wait another ten minutes for the "only cashier that could use the register" because she was taking orders out. To top that off my order was completely wrong, so I had to wait for them to make my other pizza.  Another time my fiancé and I went in to eat and the service was horrible. We barely seen our waitress and she forgot to bring the condiments for our meal. When she came by to drop off our bill and ask if we needed anything else I mentioned to her that she did not bring out any of the condiments we asked for. Her response was "oh okay", no apology or anything. She was not the friendliest waitress, which blows my mind because you'd think someone with that type of job would be nice and friendly. If you want to go to a good CPK I recommend Fashion Valley. I have never had service issues with them and they are way busier than Carmel Mountain Ranch.

Two stars just for the habanero carnita pizza because the habanero salsa has soooo much flavor and spice. Service brings down the ratings enormously. The waiter never checked on us or refilled our water. In addition, there was a tiny piece of rock or rock-like thing in the pizza.

I've tried several of their pizzas and other dishes, and the one that keeps me coming back is the BBQ Chicken Pizza with Bacon. It's a little pricey (at $14) but if you're going to CPK, you already are willing to shell out some money. The tequila lime fettucini is also pretty good. Don't forget to ask for bread if you want some. They don't give it out freely.

CPK seems to be on a downhill trend.  Used to really look forward to the food but now it's just bleh.  The waiter we had in addition to forgetting a drink order just seemed not that together.  I used to get the carne asada pizza - perhaps if they bring that one back I would give them another try.

LINDSAY G is the BEST SERVER! Came here on a day after having fasted due to labs so I was literally starved -been to several CPKs and the food is always about the same at all locations but the service is something that always varies.  Let me start by saying, I don't usually yelp about the service but maybe more of us should.  Dining out more times a month than what should be considered healthy, we've experienced our share of servers so if you're ever at the Carmel Mt. Rd. CPK location, ask to be seated in Lindsay G's area if she's working (not sure if there's more than one Lindsay there).  Totally no fuss, no hassle type of server, you let her know what you want and it's how you get it with no additional reminders. Thanks for the superfantabulous service!

No crayons for the kids; table they brought us to was filthy. Server came after 10 minutes of waiting. Service is horrible here (got two orders wrong/never came). CPK has really gone down hill from when they started.

My family and I had a wonderful experience and meal here today. The food was fresh and tasty, the drink I had was as strong as I would expect, and the wait staff was fast, frequent, and friendly, with being a distraction. A+ experience.

A special shout out to the amazing Amber! We are fans of CPK in general. We had our kids' birthday party at this location last month, and I specifically asked for Amber to be our liaison that day. Amber is the sweetest person, and went above and beyond to make sure we had a great event. She helped us with menu and activity planning. She kept me in the loop regarding scheduling of set up times, etc. She is always so nice to our family, and especially with our kids.

This was the first CPK I knew of, and I've eaten there a million times.  Known a bunch of people that have worked there, so I've always had great service there.  I very rarely strayed from my order -- a chopped salad, no tomatoes, no garbanzo beans.  Sometimes I'd experiment with a crazy pizza, and they were all delicious.  -1 point for being a chain... I just can never fully support a chain.  I want an indie!

First of all, they got my order wrong but I didn't notice till I got home (the only time I don't check).  So I call back and the manager said he will refund the payment and he never did.  Not very good business manners!

You know what CPK is, I just wanted to comment that the service we got here was exceedingly nice. The type of service where I was almost surprised they didn't "forget" to put something on our bill. Hit the spot before going in to see a movie across the parking lot.

i was pretty excited when the dessert came out (chocolate fudge with icecream), until i bit into it and found a plastic casing in my bite =/ then the manager had the nerve to say (after i did not want anymore) comp that dessert WTH???

Went to CPK last night with my kids and my sister. Ordered the tomato and basil spaghettini. In one word....AWFUL. It tasted like plastic. Something was just WRONG with the sauce. The grilled chicken I paid extra for, was cold, dry and flavorless. The lettuce in my sister's salad tasted dehydrated.  My daughter's chicken strips were deeply fried and fatty. Ranch "sauce" was watered down. I'm very curious to know how much microwaving or reheating of prepackaged food might be going on in that kitchen?  Manager refunded my money which was appreciated. But the quality of the food there is average to poor and I have now taken CPK off our list of dining out options. I'd rather get a fresh pizza from a little pizza shop and make my own fresh homemade salad.

I really love pizza, but I've never particularly been a fan of this place. Maybe because when it's busy, the wait is ridiculous and the food isn't even worth the wait. The food is decent. I like how their pizzas are unique from what you would normally get (supreme, pepperoni, etc). I also like how the crust is thin. The drinks are fun, they have a bunch of flavored lemonades and slushy type drinks. Their service is decent as well, nothing horrible, but nothing to rave about either. Final thoughts? I never really crave this place. I definitely wouldn't mind eating here again if my friends wanted to go, but I don't know if I would ever chose to eat here. The food and service are decent though. Three stars for uncrave-ability, but decent food.
Like its many corporate dining counterparts, there are no surprises. Having said that, the service was outstanding and the food is very good.

Food is always tasty here at Carmel Mountain CPK. I want to give a shout out today to our waiter Jess.  His service was perfect! He was at the table just the right amount of times.  We never had to ask for drink refills because he always brought a back-up drink shortly before it was needed.  I would definitely ask to sit in his station again!  Service with a smile! Thanks Jess!

I usually love California Pizza Kitchen but not this one.  The service is surprisingly bad considering that no one is ever in there for lunch.  At nights when they are busy then the service is a little better (I guess their better workers are working). The food has been very disappointing every time I have gone here.

After seeing the negative reviews I was hesitant to come here, even though CPK is my all time favorite place to eat. I've been here a lot, and I've never had an issue. The service is always great and the food is fantastic. I have to admit that their prices are starting to creep up, but this is a nice place to slurge every once in awhile. I HIGHLY recommend the butter cake for dessert, I'm sure it has like 10,000 calories, but who cares, it is soooo worth it, especially with a side of chocolate and carmel sauce. Mind-blowing.
One of my favorite places to come for pizza I love the BBQ Chicken Pizza it's the best!!!

Love the Thai Chicken pizza!!! YUMMMM Chipotle chicken was yummy too! can be a bit spicy at times..  The staff has always been friendly.. they even let us in one night at like 855 when they closed at 9!! way nice of them
I like the thin crust pizza, i usually get the margherita or the pesto chicken. the dakota smashed pea and barley soup is good too. they deliver through ROTR
Enjoyed the bbq chopped chicken salad and shared my favorite flat bread pizza the pear and gorgonzola.  Soooo yummy. Staff was attentive and friendly.

i feel a little ridiculous for even commenting on cpk--i mean, we all know what it's all about--but now that i live in cmr, this is my world... cpk is mediocre at best. while some of their recipes and flavors are very good (i find their pizza crust to be reeeeally tasty), portions are small and prices are high. for example: recently, my husband and i ordered half salads each and a pizza to share.  our salads were tiny--and cost 9 bucks a piece!!!   the prices are totally ridiculous for the product.  i actually like smaller portions, but i just can't justify it. but cpk won't miss us. people seem to love waiting 20-40 minutes on a weeknight to get nickeled and dimed.

While my meal was great, I happened to notice that the manager ROBERT, was yelling and acting very inappropriately.  He was acting very rude and disrespectful towards his staff, who were working very hard, and had an overall poor attitude. I even noticed other customers viewing his actions. This is extremely poor customer service on the manager ROBERT's part. I would not recommend going here while he is working. Cpk should definitely consider removing him from a management position -Harry

It's hard for me to pinpoint just one reason why I'm giving this place a 1 star review. Perhaps it was the hostess' choice to seat us with our ears next to a constantly slamming door while an indoor/outdoor 10 year old birthday party was in full swing, or maybe it was our disappearing waitress who we saw for ordering, food delivery, and check delivery. Too bad we wanted more dressing! Maybe it was the cold, stale bread, or the fact that my salad had brown lettuce and 3 bite size pieces of chicken in it. Maybe it was when I asked to speak to a manager and they sent over a sous-chef while the manager from then on completely avoided our section of the restaurant. All I know is I won't be trying it again to figure it out.

Love the small cravings arugala asparagus salad and the dressing has just the right amount of acid. Tried the new broccoli artichoke soup, not the best soup, but adequate. Chicken Milanase was surprisingly good.  The chicken was lightly breaded, tasty and very moist. My standard favorite is the chicken picatta as I love anything with lemon and capers.  Arrived after 8pm to eat, service was slower than usual which surprised me as they were not that busy as we did not have to wait to be seated.  The manager was polite and friendly and came over to apologize for the delay in our dinner entrees.  She said it was her fault due to set up on the line and dessert was on her.  Ordered our favorite, their delicious red velvet cake with ice cream.  Love the plate and presentation of the cake.  Not one bite left.  Waiter wasn't very attentive as i was thirsty and dislike having to ask for refills.  It wasn't that busy so he could easily check up on us.  CPK is still a favorite.

Why oh why would you ever go to CPK for pizza? There's so much better selections out there than this. The pizza isn't even that good and they are small. The target food court pizza smashes on all of them. At least you can get some breadsticks with it. Sheeeet.
You can't go wrong with CPK. It's great all-together. But there's no doubt that the Solana Beach one is much nicer.

Im giving it 3 stars because the food was good and the head cook dealt with our situation really well. I work in a restaurant so i get it, its busy and you cant make it to every table as much as you would like but this was just awful! I have been in other cpks before but this one is just disappointing it looks like a cafeteria. We sat down and our server didnt come by to take our drink order for quite a while. Finally he takes both our drink and food order at the same time. It took a while for our drinks to come out but whatever. Our guacamole came out and it was pretty good. Finally our food came out it was dropped by another person and our server never came by to see if we were ok and we had to flag him down to get refills. About halfway through our meal my boyfriend found something in his pasta idk what it was, we couldnt figure it out so we flagged down our server who just said I will be right back and disappeared? A while later the head cook from the kitchen came out and we showed her what was in our pasta and said if you can just tell us what this is its fine if it was part of one of the ingredients. She had no idea what it was, so she decided to buy us dessert. a while later our server walked up with our dessert and asked us if the chef was covering the dessert? Really? How do you not know that and why did you not ever check on us in between to make sure we were alright? UGGHH annoying awful service! The food was really good so next time I go there it will definitely be for take out.

Chain. Restaurant. However...it is one of the better ones. Went here during the week for dinner with my daughter and we split a salad and a pizza plus dessert and it was good. The service was a bit slow, however friendly and the considering the food being so "standard" it was okay, but the bill was on the pricier side for mediocre food. It's alright.
One of my favorite restaurants around. The food is too die for, the employees are very nice, and the prices are fair. I always use curbside service :)

I AM A BIG CPK FAN! This place never disappoints with the food. I love their corn chowder to death! I mean I could eat this stuff for days and weeks and months-okay maybe thats a stretch, but it seems like I could do it. I usually get their veggie foccacia sandwich which makes my tummy smile! Everything their is nom nom nom worthy. The only reason it is getting a star removed is because when I got here on my lunch it seems to take foreeevvverrr to get my food. Even when it doesnt seem to be that busy I wait half an hour for my food. Its okay my love is still there for CPK and I will stick up for it until the day I die.....or get a worm in my food ;)

This the first and only CPK that I have been to. I loved this place the first time I went here. I went here once before and I liked the food. This time we came and not sure what I wanted to get. I looked through the menu and when I finished the food search I decided on getting the chicken tequila fettuccine. The place wasn't as busy as last time I went. We did arrive at around 8pm on Thursday during the chargers game. It should probably be a little bit more busy. I also tried the teriyaki chicken salad which was ok. It seemed a little salty. I also had a glass of the sangria which was more sweet than good. I think it should have been more wine tasting than sweet.

Food is good.  Service, well, I guess for us it was a rip off!  We used a gift card and left cash for the tip.  The next time we went back, our gift card had less money on it than what it said on the receipt.  Seems like another tip was deducted for the same amount of cash we left.  We are long time fans of CPK but will be avoiding this location from now on.

The food is ok. Avocado egg rolls are always good. Had the lettuce wraps also. Those pretty much taste the same everyone. OHH our waiter was soooooooo rude. Too bad I forgot his name! Ruined this experience. Service is so important sometimes. The pizza is alright, either salty or sweet, crust is eh, a lil dry. Not coming to THIS ONE again.
I love this place as it has lot of vegetarian options. My favorites: Portobello Mushroom Ravioli (with a mix of white and red sauce) Chipotle Chicken (without the chicken ) Tostada Pizza

Real problem with CPK's expanded menu, due to prices.  CPK's always been a place to eat when I'm willing to spend a little extra $$ or for a business meal. But their expanded menu is missing the mark on price vs. value. Ordered an entree spaghetti that's half the size of what I'd get as an Italian restaurant side dish, at twice the price. Ordered mac and cheese and paid $10 (shame on me)  CPK's introduced a small portions menu, which helps trim costs, but seeing these is a sure sign that a restaurant knows it's over-charging.   And of course, the portions are small, too.  CPK's usual stellar service fell short last night, too. I'll be back there, but will stick with their pizza and half-salad menu, with somewhat decent prices. Avoid their expanded menu!
Hmmmm not sure what the fuss is about but Mark my server did an excellent job, and my visit was extrodinary. Hes the best!

Waitress was great, food was mediocre but the cost was exhorbitant for what we got. Wine by the HALF glass was $5.  If you wanted a FULL glass, it was close to $10.  This is the first time I have ever heard of any restaurant selling wine by the HALF GLASS.  It was insulting! And we're talking about the house wine.  Are you kidding me?  Needless to say, we didn't get the wine.  So a 4 cheese pizza that we split and salad that we split was $35 with a tip.  We will spend our entertaining money ELSEWHERE!

I am normally a big fan of CPK and have sought them out whenever traveling in other states, etc.  However, at this Carmel Mountain location, I have experienced repeated poor service to the point that I no longer wish to go.  My orders are almost always "to go" or "Curbside" and half of the time, they are incorrect or missing something.  My daughter loves their Dakota Split Pea Soup or else I wouldn't keep playing Russian Roulette by ordering from  them.  Most of the time, they are gracious enough about fixing their errors.  However, earlier this week, they left out my daughter's soup in a take-out order.  I called to let them know and the server that answered never apologized to me and was very rude (just asked me if I even was charged for it, which I was) and said something to the effect of, "Well, do you want to come back and get it?"  I was so upset because I had friends over, I was already late for putting my daughter down to a nap and then the unhelpful tenor of the gal's voice just put me over the edge.  A friend offered to go back and pick up the soup.  Luckily, the manager was there and my friend filled him in on what had happened.  They did give me 2 soups and a free entree for later.  I would have preferred nice & accurate service the first time around.   The service I got from  the cashier/phone operator was deplorable.

I had lunch here with my girlfriend last week.  I had the pizza and it's always good.  I've tried CPK many times, I don't many of their entrees except for the pizza.  I'm going to give the pizza alone 4 stars.  Why go to a Pizza Kitchen and have something other than what they're known for?  The waitress is very friendly.  She constantly refilled our drinks.  I love it.  I'd recommend to anyone.

I only go to CPK for pizza because they are one of the few places that makes a really good wheat dough.  Other than that, the service is slow to mediocre, the other food is just decent, and the prices are kind of expensive.
